items.content:
Information Designer – Graphic Designer at Piktochart

Remote | International
  • Penang or Remote in South East Asia / South America / Europe

We’re looking for a passionate information designer to help us craft stories out of data by using design to amplify and clarify the message for our users. You will be designing visual information representations for qualitative and qualitative concepts that are scalable, flexible and adaptable for different communication situations. You will work alongside product teams to translate information design principles into product functionalities.

You will have an excellent background in graphic design, information design, data visualisation and complementary skills in conceptualising and designing visual stories. Alongside this, you will have a good overall grasp of digital design and an acute attention to detail. You will have experience across a mix of projects and broad portfolio youre proud of that includes a range of outputs from print to static and interactive digital formats. The ideal candidate is looking to merge their design skills with storytelling and enjoys solving the problem of How do I best convey interesting information & stories in a visually appealing, easy to understand manner.

Your mission :

  • Analyze and represent data to tell a clear story through data visualization and infographics.
  • Solve data visualization and communications challenges in a variety of formats including infographics, charts, diagrams, maps and more.
  • Taking charge and owning projects from idea/concept to delivery , particularly ensuring design excellence.
  • Collaborate in ideation sessions and sketch concepts in high detail.
  • Able to deliver a variety of art direction.
  • Delivering projects on time, being resourceful with time allocated.
  • Bringing thought leadership, inspiration and innovation in the area of information design to the company.

You offer:

  • Strong experience with data visualization and information design principles, including the graphical display of quantitative information and illustrating qualitative concepts.
  • Strong portfolio of producing a broad range of compelling information design, visual stories and interactive work across different audiences, topics and objectives.
  • Outstanding analytical skills: ability to listen to complex ideas and distill them into easy to understand concepts.
  • Proficient in Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, or similar design tools.
  • Proficient in Tableau, QilkSense, PowerBI, D3JS or similar data visualization tools.
  • Experience using Excel / Spreadsheet software with an added bonus for experience with any of R/RStudio, SAS, MATLAB, Python etc to aid data-driven design.
  • Strong handle on typography, layout, space, inherent feel for motion.
  • Care about both business strategy and user needs.
  • Enjoy organizing information.
  • Relish the challenge of integrating words and visual design.
  • Able to interact cross functionally in an enthusiastic and positive manner.
  • Able to be independent to conceptualise and execute innovative approaches.
  • Process-minded and organized, can manage multiple projects at once and tight deadlines while remaining calm, collected, and positive.
  • Flexibility to work with design direction change and humble to receive feedback.
  • A collaborative spirit and ability to see potential in a broad variety of content and stories.

Location

  • Penang, Malaysia
  • Remote in SEA
  • Remote in South America / Europe

Who are we?

We are transforming the visual storytelling space by delivering an effortless user experience in creating beautiful, professional-grade visuals. By pushing the limits of whats possible in technology and taking time to understand our users, Piktochart has empowered over 10 million users worldwide to visually communicate in ways that were not possible before!

The team that is behind Piktochart consists of 14 nationalities spread across 8 countries. Pair programming, mentorship, code reviews and group learning all form part of our daily lives and we consider it a privilege to continuously learn. The HOPEFUL values define our culture and inform our actions and decisions.

Apply for job

items.content:
Visual Designer (Freelance)


The Opportunity

Modern Tribe is looking for a talented, detail oriented Visual Designer to join our team. Our projects involve creating large-scale digital design systems for high-profile clients across multiple industries – including higher education, sports, food and beverage and more. We’re looking for experienced designers, comfortable working at any point in the design process. Our designers are experienced in UX, love research, insist on wireframing, and are comfortable reading and writing spec documents. Whether we’re designing applications, new products, or websites – our designers are focused on empowering users and achieving results


What You'll Do

  • Design websites, products, apps and a variety of digital and physical assets
  • Master the needs of our clients – working within the boundaries of their brand while elevating them by generating original concepts
  • Integrate stringent brand guidelines to create a rich look and feel
  • Work with a multi disciplinary team to execute within the entire design lifecycle including research, wireframing, prototyping, visual design and testing.
  • Create new design systems and contribute to existing systems
  • Speak to clients and stakeholders and present your work
  • Use design to elevate the storytelling capabilities for our clients and ourselves
Above and beyond your individual talents, we’re looking for someone to join our team. We’re a very collaborative bunch, eager for feedback. The work we execute is the product of the team. If you’re excited about learning from others, and helping others – you’ll find a good home here.If that sounds like you, get in touch.


What We're Looking For

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • You produce smart and beautiful design, demonstrating a strong understanding of typography, color and layout
  • You demonstrate diverse taste, with the knowledge of what styles are appropriate to apply to a given task or project
  • Knowledge of user interface design, ux design, product design, and the creative process.
  • Strong understanding of current design tools
  • BONUS: Experience in content creation, marketing, and copywriting
  • BONUS: Demonstrable history of working on large-scale projects and producing holistic design systems
  • BONUS: Understanding of product development lifecycle

Compensation

The pay range is USD $45-75 per hour commensurate with background, qualifications and experience. We often start our freelancers on a one time contract position (though we are always seeking long standing relationships with awesome people).


Location

Work from anywhere in North, Central or South America. If your timezone is outside of US business hours but you work at least 4+ hours of overlap each day, let’s chat. You must be fluent in English. You just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe


Inclusion Statement

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80’s movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.


Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).


Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY: Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL: Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS: It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE: Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.
  • FREELANCER: This means that if you live within the USA, you will also maintain your own personal client list and that Modern Tribe will only comprise a portion of your total income. Regardless of where you live, you need to be already freelancing.

items.content:
Graphic Designer at Pear Deck

Remote
Do you get excited about a really gorgeous brand standards manual? Are you interested in making a difference while making great puns? Do you want to be part of a fun, growing, passionate team, working to make life better for teachers and students?

Pear Deck is looking for a graphic designer to join our marketing team. If you have an eye for detail, endless curiosity, and a strong sense of urgency, you might be just who we’re looking for. (Being a dog lover doesn’t hurt, either.) We’re a close-knit team that wears a lot of hats, thrives on collaboration, and loves a good group brainstorm.

You bring top-notch design and communication skills, enthusiasm, and tenacity; we’ll bring a work environment full of empathy, excitement, and the best coworkers ever.

(A quick note about location: while Pear Deck is headquartered in Iowa City, IA, we are open to candidates working remotely from anywhere in the U.S.)

On any given day you’ll…
  • Produce print (flyers, postcards, merch) and digital (social media, email) graphics under the Pear Deck brand. You’ll also help produce interactive templates using Google Slides and PowerPoint.
  • Make edits to the Pear Deck website using Squarespace, and build emails using Hubspot.
  • Attend brainstorms and strategy meetings, contributing ideas to help Pear Deck grow and thrive.
  • Help our team prepare for events and initiatives with a strong sense of creativity and urgency.
  • Be self-motivated, attentive to detail, and enthusiastic!
Prerequisites:
  • Expertise in the Adobe Creative Cloud suite, particularly Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign
  • Knowledge of Google Suite
  • A strong portfolio of previous work
  • Excellent written communication skills and attention to detail
  • Strategic thinking skills, curiosity, and eagerness to share ideas
  • High sense of urgency and attention to deadlines
  • At least 3 years of experience in the graphic design field

Not required, but we’d love to see:

  • Experience working with Squarespace and/or Hubspot
  • Video editing and/or animation skills (Premiere Pro, After Effects)
  • Experience working on a remote team
  • Education (BA, BFA, or equivalent) in design and/or art
About Pear Deck

Pear Deck is a five-year-old funded startup headquartered in Iowa City, IA, focused on helping teachers deliver powerful learning moments to every student, every day. By joining Pear Deck at this stage in our growth, you will be getting in during an exciting time as we expand our team while maintaining our humanity. So, if you like the idea of working on a close-knit crew as we face the challenges of scaling both our customers and our team, this is the perfect time to jump in.

We value diversity and encourage people from all walks of life to join our team. We believe a wealth of perspectives helps Pear Deck serve its teachers better.

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Senior UI – UX Designer, Product at Whitespectre

Remote | Freelance | International | Part-time

Location: Worldwide

We are a remote-first company with a globally distributed team of 70. We’re proud of the way we get great work done. Our clients love working with us and we partner with them on long-term projects. Our teams are engaged and excited about our work.

We’re looking for a smart, hardworking, creative, and collaborative individual to help us create intuitive and engaging experiences for our client partners.

This is a part-time role to start with the possibility to move to full-time.

What You’ll Do

Our projects are a combination of launching then evolving brand-new products, as well as taking existing products to the next level. In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, the wider UX team, and our client partners to deliver beautiful, engaging experiences. That’s everything from wires and prototyping, to presenting to stakeholders, to reviewing user feedback, to designing polished interfaces, and overall, working hand in hand with the team to ensure that the software and mobile apps we create both look and ‘feel’ great.

As an ideal candidate, you’ll have:

  • Several years experience in UI/UX design, with experience designing both responsive sites and applications as well as native mobile applications (IOS, Android, React Native).
  • Experience working within a team across the entire product lifecycle, from user research to requirements gathering and prototyping to launch and feedback and iteration cycles
  • A strong foundation in visual design principles (typography, layout, color, etc.)and using animations to communicate with the user.
  • Excellent English-language communication skills, both spoken and written. Because of our close collaboration with our English-speaking clients, you must be able to engage confidently with them in design discussions.
  • Availability to work within a fast moving team (working 11am – 8pm Central European time)
  • A robust portfolio of past projects and live examples you can walk us through

Please provide a link to your current portfolio. Candidates without portfolios will not be considered.

To be successful in this role, you’ll also be:

  • Passionate about creating products that deliver both a first-class user experience as well as real business results.
  • Seriously detail-oriented. You pride yourself on delivering designs that are accurate and consistent. You enjoy thinking through the multiple scenarios and perspective in each user experience you create.
  • Committed to keeping up with ‘best practices’ and new design thinking. You’re naturally curious, you’re constantly reviewing new apps and products, you can speak comfortably on the pros and cons of the latest design trends
  • Comfortable in fast-paced, collaborative environments.
Apply for job

items.title: Senior UI UX Engineer
items.content:
SignalWire

Senior UI UX Engineer

SignalWire is a startup evolved from the engineers behind FreeSWITCH, the open-source Software-Defined Telecom platform.  We are looking for someone with amazing development skills in the field of UI/UX and the ability to scale themselves to eventually lead a team and execute our vision. We are a distributed team so most of our workforce is remote and work-anywhere based.  We have a disciplined engineering team who communicates over live video chat using our own remote workplace technology and other tools like slack and Github. Connect with us if you are looking to make something challenging and exciting to be a part of.

items.content:
Senior UI / UX Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Cloud Services, Communications, Telecommunications
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: SignalWire | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 4 hours

Technologies

reactjs
react-native
user-interface
webrtc
javascript

Job description

SignalWire is a startup evolved from the engineers behind FreeSWITCH, the open-source Software-Defined Telecom platform.  We are looking for someone with amazing development skills in the field of UI/UX and the ability to scale themselves to eventually lead a team and execute our vision.

We are a distributed team so most of our workforce is remote and work-anywhere based.  We have a disciplined engineering team who communicates over live video chat using our own remote workplace technology and other tools like slack and Github.

Connect with us if you are looking to make something challenging and exciting to be a part of.

Apply now

About SignalWire

We are the real OGs and leaders of the decentralized communications movement. We are a distributed company bringing together some of the best people in the world to solve a really big problem. We collaborate via video chat in a completely virtual office environment that utilizes our own tech. Our main goal is to make complex IP communications technology accessible to everyone with an easy-to-use interface.

Anthony Minessale, CEO - Creator of our open source communications platform, FreeSWITCH and a pioneer in the advanced communications industry.

Evan McGee, CTO - An expert in microservices and real-time cloud architectures with over a decade of experience in telecom. Evan helped create and grow the RingPlus MVNO from a blue-sky project to 120k+ mobile users.

Bryan Rite, Director of Cloud Engineering - An experienced full-stack engineer and developer with 20+ years in the industry. Co-founded the small business telecommunications platform Felix, and helped build, scale, and innovate for RingPlus, a nationwide wireless MVNO.

Christopher Rienzo, Director of Stack Engineering - Responsible for building the SignalWire platform for enterprises. Prior to joining SignalWire, Chris was the director of engineering for voice systems at Grasshopper.

Benefits

  • Work Remotely
  • Be involved in developing cutting-edge cloud communications technology
  • Competitive compensation and benefits packages

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product UX – UI Designer at Prezly

Remote | International
  • Product
  • Remote job

Job description

Prezly is looking for a UI/UX designer to boost our capacity in creating a world with more meaningful communication between organisations and people. Working closely with a product manager and builders to craft high-quality, impactful, and inclusive user experiences for communication experts all around the world.

As a product designer, you’ll be joining at an exciting time where design/user experience is becoming fundamental to our culture. You’ll be working in your own team that consists of design and engineering resources to drive projects forward.

We need you to help us build an amazing product depending on the day this might be user research activities with our customers, communicating a user flow, designing a user flow, building an interactive prototype, getting to pixel-level perfection in a mockup, or sitting side-by-side with an engineer during implementation of your experiences. You will work on a variety of projects, from conceptual to tactical to growth mostly around the core Prezly product. Your work will ship continuously (when its done). You will have a direct impact in our customers experience and the overall trajectory of the business.

As our new teammate, youll be self-driven and work hard to bring value to your new company in the most effective way possible. Youll work hard to make those around you better, communicate clearly, and make Prezly a better company.

Requirements

  • You have a creative mind and are able to see ideas through from concept to execution.
  • You efficiently collaborate with others, are always open to receive and constructively give feedback to people from all teams.
  • You have a good understanding of frontend development and can craft functioning prototypes or fix a spacing issue while doing QA
  • Your portfolio shows your skills in product design
  • You are enthusiastic to learn and grow as a UX/UI designer and a member of a software company.

You will

  • Collaborate with other designer, engineers, and the founding team
  • Develop creative ideas and concepts together with the team
  • Rapidly sketch, prototype, provide options, articulate UX/UI tradeoffs, and iterate quickly
  • Build wireframes, interactive prototypes and polished designs
  • Lead design reviews with company leadership and provide expertise on how design can drive business results
  • Drive design through data, build methods to collect and analyze data from user interactions, run/attend experiments and user interviews
  • Translate design decisions into style guides, patterns and reusable components for other teammates to use to build the product
  • Implement strategies for standardizing design patterns across the site to speed development velocity across the team
  • Work directly with our engineers, delivering assets and assistance in building fully functional user interfaces
  • Help build a culture that promotes and values design throughout the organization

You will get

  • Competitive salary with the option for equity
  • Great tools: What would Batman be without his utility belt? He’d still be badass. But you get the point. At Prezly you’ll get to choose your own gear.
  • Flexible hours: There’s a life outside of work. That’s why our distributed team works from where they want, when they want. And they get tons of work done.
  • Unlimited vacation time: We evaluate on value, not on time spent behind desks. Employees can take as many holidays as they need. This way they bring their A-game to the job.
  • Visits to Leuven: A few times per year the entire team gets together in the office in Leuven, the worlds capital of beer. We’ll fly you in so you can have fun with the team.
Apply for job

Social Gamma is looking to expand the team!


We are looking for an amazing designer to join our team for 15-20 hours a week. We are looking for a recent Design graduate or student that is eager to learn and work in a fast pace environment and who is based in London. You can work remotely and would only need to come to the office once or twice a week for internal meetings. So, if you are passionate about design and social media, look no further – Social Gamma is the place for you.


This internship will help you acquire design skills and provide you with knowledge of various design methods. Ultimately, you will gain broad experience in design working with a diverse range of clients and should be prepared to enter any fast-paced work environment.


Responsibilities:


Knowledge of social media and digital marketing


Creation of visuals, social media grid mock-ups, e-mail campaigns, online promotions, etc. 


Assist in the distribution or delivery of digital marketing content


Provide strategy and suggestions for social media execution


Available for a minimum of 15 hours a week


Skills Required:


Excellent English (written and verbal)


Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite Photoshop expert


Eager to learn


Team player


What we offer:


Free coffee and tea


Casual dress code


Central London office


Fun team


Hands-on experience


Who we are:


We are a start-up digital agency based in the heart of London that is growing quickly. We work for clients from all over the world within several industries, from fashion to tech to non-profits! You will never get bored at Social Gamma.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Graphic design internship


We are looking for a graphic design student or graduate to carry out a handful of graphic communication projects to support our product launch. Your work will help radically reduce unnecessary waste in the food industry.


About us


At Mimica, we’re developing a label, Mimica Touch, that tells you exactly when food spoils. We are driven by reducing food waste and improving food safety for everyone. We are preparing to launch our product in the market and we’re looking for someone who can help us create a set of assets to support our critical first steps in the market as part of our team in London or remotely.


You


We’re looking for someone passionate about sustainability, making a difference to food waste reduction and food security and who wants to see how a startup company operates from the inside. You should have excellent attention to detail, be comfortable with self-managing and willing to learn on the job too.


Some of your activities may include:



  • Upgrading the mimicalab.com website

  • Adapting our label graphics to fit industry standards

  • Designing a beautiful and clear sales presentation

  • Infographic design

  • Graphics for social media content

  • Launch campaign assets

  • Anything else within the scope of the above


Internship length and work hours


We are flexible with the length of the internship, but envisage something between 1-2 months. We are also open to this being a longer, part time internship. We hope that the internship can commence in September.


Our typical intern work hours are between 9-5pm Monday-Thursday, although work hours are very flexible and we're happy to work around your schedule.


Reward


This is a paid internship at national minimum wage. You will also have access to free events and training courses through our various memberships for the duration of your internship.


Location


We’re based in Shoreditch in East London, a short walk away from Old Street station and Liverpool Street station. This internship can also be carried out remotely - please make sure you let us know which one you’d prefer in your cover letter.


Contact


If we’ve made your brain itch, please get in touch and send your CV, short portfolio and a bit about your interest in the position to solveiga@mimicalab.com.

items.content:
Senior Brand Designer at Mozilla

Remote | Freelance

Remote US

Sr. Brand Designer at Mozilla Overview:
Mozilla is a community of engineers, designers, makers and problem solvers. We work in the fishbowl known as open source, with a clear focus on making the web better. We are currently hiring a contract Brand designer in our San Francisco location. Working with us, you’ll help build amazing experiences, and help us tell our story to a growing audience.

Mozilla isn’t just a great place to work. It’s an experience you’ll carry with you throughout your career. From the passionate people you’ll learn from, to the chances you’ll have to make the Web a better place, your time with Mozilla will be unlike any other. To be part of the team, we ask that you be awesome, intelligent, and proud to be moving the mission forward.

The role:
Initially, this role will focus on working closely with our Head of Brand Design to refine, expand, systemize, and bring to life the Firefox brand expression across all touchpoints. You will help conceptualize, develop, and implement our brand identity, including work on a variety of guidelines and narratives across social, digital, print, blog, and web.

You are:
A smart and passionate Sr. Graphic Designer with a strong and diverse portfolio showcasing experience across a variety of mediums, including digital, print, web, and environmental/experiential design. You’re comfortable asking questions, interested in data and research, and looking to create user-centered experiences. You think on a macro and a micro level, make decisions that support both the system and the individual component. You are well versed in both digital and print and are able to contribute on both levels, from concept to final production. You have experience designing and shipping consumer-facing digital products as well as working on one-off projects that may include comms, social, and print components. You’re passionate about how things work and interact and in creating a visually cohesive and well-designed experience.

You will:

  • Help with intake and shape project strategy, process and goals.
  • Work closely with Design Leads, key stakeholders, and our Producer and Creative Director to understand the requirements of a creative brief, develop concepts, iterate quickly, and ship experiences in a digital and print framework.
  • Think systemically and help create a pain-free and delightful experience for the user.
  • Demonstrate solutions to external partners and iterate quickly on feedback.
  • Advocate for the importance of user-centered design and consumer quality experiences on the team and within the greater organization.

Your Professional Profile:

  • Passion to design excellent products for humans
  • 5+ years of professional experience in graphic design
  • Strong portfolio of interaction, brand, and visual design
  • Ability to rapidly conceive, visualize and iterate design solutions in a shared environment
  • Excellent communication skills (or relevant experience)
  • Experience designing and shipping digital consumer-facing products

Pluses:

  • Knowledge of user research
  • Strong visual design skills
  • Type, color, layout, hierarchy
  • Iconography and illustration
  • Image making
  • Experience with creating digital design systems
  • Multi-disciplinary, always-learning mindset
  • Experience in working on a distributed team

About Mozilla
Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job

    solutions for global campaigns.

    • Contribute to build, improve, and further Cubbit's brand locally and globally.

      collaterals.

    • Creative mindset.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Niphtio

 

UI UX Designer For Web

Do you care about designing applications that are both beautiful and functional? At Niphtio, we're looking for a UI/UX designer to join us in building the next-generation of content aggregation and curation tools. You will be one of our first hires, and will be working closely with our small team of software developers as well as our founder/CEO. You'll have plenty of autonomy and real opportunities to grow and build your skills here. Your role will be to design the various user interfaces of our applications (primarily web, possibly also iOS and Android). Responsibilities will include: * Advocating for user experience and working with the rest of our team to define requirements for product features. * Producing concept specifications, wireframes and flow diagrams in order to communicate design ideas with the rest of the team. * Soliciting feedback on your designs from other team members and articulating the reasons for your design decisions. * Creating UI mock-ups in production-quality responsive HTML and CSS. * Measuring and assessing usability of deployed features. Basic experience with using git is a plus, but we care more about your ability to learn new things and your passion for excellence in our craft than preexisting knowledge in any specific technology. You will have a direct influence on setting the direction of our products as well as shaping our company culture from the ground up. We are a 100% remote team. (USA and Canada only -- we are not able to sponsor or transfer visas for this position.)

items.content:
Designer at Memberful

Remote | International

Memberful is reliable membership software for independent publishers, educators, and creators. We recently joined Patreon, and we’re excited to continue expanding our team. You’ll work directly with our current product team and any new engineers we bring on in the coming months.

What we’re looking for

It’s fun and rewarding to work with people who are enthusiastic and get stuff done. At Memberful, we’re a self managed team. We don’t require heavy direction or daily check-ins. This means you’ll come up with your own goals and execute them. You’ll discover, plan, and see things through from start to finish. This job is for you if:

  • You’re enthusiastic about life and work on a daily basis.
  • You embrace responsibility and new challenges.
  • You care deeply about form and function.
  • You look for opportunities to improve process.
  • You thrive on organization and planning.
  • You do what it takes to get things done on time.
  • You have experience working remotely and enjoy it.
  • You recognize it’s about building a great product, and therefore embrace discussion and criticism of ideas.
  • You don’t like working with complainers or blamers.
  • You don’t claim to be an expert at everything, but you show a strong desire to learn new things and continually get better.
  • You don’t just report the problem, you present a plan for fixing it.

You should be hungry and excited to take on real responsibility and work hardon useful software with real paying customers.

What you’ll work on

We’re a very small team, so you’ll have a unique opportunity to make a big impact. You’ll be working on a product used by well over hundred thousand people, and we’ll be counting on you to challenge us and lead Memberful in exciting new directions. You’ll bring creativity, fresh perspective, and a skeptical but open mind to our process.

You’ll work on a variety of different things at Memberful, including our website, product strategy, and product marketing, but you’ll mostly be working with one or two talented engineers to plan, design, and build exciting new features for Memberful customers. You’ll also work with our customers directly to help understand the problems we’re trying to solve.

Skills, Salary, & Benefits

You should have visual taste, design talent, and excellent writing skills. You know copywriting is at the core of great design. You should also write well-structured HTML/CSS, as you’ll be responsible for designing and building the frontend of our product. Rails experience is a bonus, but definitely not required.

  • Competitive salary based on experience.
  • Work remotely from anywhere in the world.
  • Flexible vacation. Take it when you need it.
  • Health insurance if you’re in the United States.
Apply for job

items.content:
komoot

Web Designer

verified
UTC-1 to UTC+3
**Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times — and with more than 8 million users and 50,000 five-star reviews, komoot is on its way to becoming one of the world’s most popular cycling and hiking apps. Behind the app screen is a passionate fully remote team working from 12 countries — that’s over 50 people with a shared mission to help our users experience real-life adventures, on foot or by bike. If you’d like to help to build the future of outdoor exploration, we’re looking for a talented, enthusiastic Web Designer to join our team.** # Responsibilities **Why you will love it** * Your work will enable millions of people to have awesome outdoor experiences * You’ll build and improve a product that we’re pretty sure you’ll end up using for your own outdoor trips * You’ll be developing in fast cycles with continuous testing and building based on direct user feedback * You will become a key player amongst a team of highly motivated and talented people * We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house or anywhere else that lies in any time zone situated between UTC-1 and UTC+3 * You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides **What you will do** * Own and drive the web design of core komoot products and take a lead on individual UX work streams * Conceptualize original web design ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex roadblocks, and improve and optimize landing pages * Develop new layouts and interfaces and implement them in CSS and JavaScript * Create mockups, prototypes and user flows to communicate interaction and design ideas * Come up with new features as well as improve the existing ones, test ideas with users and run A/B tests * Work closely with other designers, backend team members and product managers in quick iteration cycles based on real feedback from users # items.content:
Web Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Designer
Industry: Cycling, Information Technology, Mobile Application
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: komoot | Potsdam, Germany

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Potsdam, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

user-experience
user-interface
javascript
css
figma-api

Job description

Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times — and with more than 8 million users and 50,000 five-star reviews, komoot is on its way to becoming one of the world’s most popular cycling and hiking apps. Behind the app screen is a passionate fully remote team working from 12 countries — that’s over 50 people with a shared mission to help our users experience real-life adventures, on foot or by bike. If you’d like to help to build the future of outdoor exploration, we’re looking for a talented, enthusiastic Web Designer to join our team.

Your key responsibilities

  • Own and drive the web design of core komoot products and take a lead on individual UX work streams
  • Conceptualize original web design ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex roadblocks, and improve and optimize landing pages
  • Develop new layouts and interfaces and implement them in CSS and JavaScript
  • Create mockups, prototypes and user flows to communicate interaction and design ideas
  • Come up with new features as well as improve the existing ones, test ideas with users and run A/B tests
  • Work closely with other designers, backend team members and product managers in quick iteration cycles based on real feedback from users

Why you will love it

  • Your work will enable millions of people to have awesome outdoor experiences
  • You’ll build and improve a product that we’re pretty sure you’ll end up using for your own outdoor trips
  • You’ll be developing in fast cycles with continuous testing and building based on direct user feedback
  • You will become a key player amongst a team of highly motivated and talented people
  • We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house or anywhere else that lies in any time zone situated between UTC-1 and UTC+3
  • You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides

You will be successful in this position if you

  • Have 3+ years of experience as a Web designer, UI/UX designer or similar role related to web-based products
  • Can clearly demonstrate and apply your outstanding skills in developing and implementing layouts, interfaces and user flows
  • Are highly skilled in HTML, CSS, Figma, and Sketch and have a good knowledge of JavaScript
  • Have an excellent eye for design and attention to detail: you’re obsessed with designing awesome products that users love
  • You are up-to-date with the latest web technologies, techniques, and features
  • Have experience working in a remote team, hand in hand with developers
  • Have good communication skills and enjoy working with teammates in quick iteration cycles based on real feedback from users

Sounds like you?

Send us the following

  • Your CV
  • A write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in working at komoot
  • Examples of your work (e.g. GitHub, PDFs, Dribble, Slideshare, etc.)
  • Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account, or your OpenStreetMap profile if you have one

Apply Now

Change the Way People Explore!

Apply now

About komoot

Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help users all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, and we empower everybody to explore more of the great outdoors.

Join our team and change the way people explore outdoors! www.komoot.com/jobs

Benefits

  • Work wherever you thrive
  • 38 paid vacation days
  • Health insurance
  • Latest computers and devices
  • Company gatherings 3 times/year

items.content:
Visual Designer at Modus Create

Remote | Freelance | International
  • Multiple Countries
  • Contracted
  • Visual Design
  • Mid Level

Work with our UX designers to understand user needs and design effective, trust-worthy interfaces to achieve business and user goals.

At Modus Create you will put your creativity to work on cross-functional Scrum teams to deliver high quality, intuitive experiences for a diverse portfolio of global clients and brands.

Note: This is full-time contract opportunity (40 hours/week), can be done remotely.

Your Job Duties:

  • Create high fidelity mockups from wireframes, sketches, and low fidelity prototypes.
  • Work with stakeholders to understand their vision and bring it to life
  • Communicate to a cross-functional team to present your designs effectively
  • Be able to work on multiple projects
  • Be comfortable designing, creating UI in a fast paced environment
  • Produce brand standards, style guides, and design system libraries across mobile, tablet, and desktop.
  • Be comfortable collaborating in design team reviews, sharing and brainstorming ideas with remote/distributed team

Required experience:

  • Have experience promoting, defending, and articulating your design decisions to stakeholders
  • Have previous experience designing for mobile and for web
  • Apply appropriate best practices and trends to design solutions for our clients and users
  • Be proficient with Adobe Creative Suite and/or Sketch
  • Have a Dribbble, Behance or other portfolio site to showcase your work

Nice to Have, but not Required:

  • Have experience working in an agile environment
  • Be active in the design community
  • Broader interest or experience in UX design
  • Data visualization experience

Let’s Talk About Us

Recognized over the years by Inc. Magazine as the top ranked software company in the Washington, D.C., Virginia and Maryland area, Modus Create is a product agency that helps clients accelerate their digital transformation goals. Modus’ accelerates business outcomes with its integrated strategy, customer experience, Agile/DevOps, and emerging technology practices. Additionally, Modus is a proud partner of Atlassian, IonicFramework, GitHub Enterprise and AWS.

We are a global team that has grown from 2 to 185+ people in 42+ countries in 8 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm .

We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

The perks

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

items.content:
UX/UI Designer (m/f/x) – part-time // Visable Labs

Company: Visable Labs

Tags:
  • UI Design
  • UX Design
  • Visual Design
  • interaction designer
  • UX Designer

    • At Visable Labs we strive to connect demand and supply in the digitized B2B world. As a laboratory for innovative solutions in tech, product and marketing we help purchasers to stay ahead of the game on all platforms of the Visable Group. With a reach of more than 3.7 million B2B purchasers per month, the Visable Group is operating the leading B2B marketplaces in the D-A-CH region “Wer liefert was” (wlw) as well as the European B2B platform EUROPAGES in 26 countries.

    As part of the Visable Group, we are backed up by a proven business and as a separate entity, we work in cross functional teams, agile and at full speed like a startup. Our headquarter’s in Hamburg and offices in Berlin and Paris make us a truly European company.

    As a UX/UI designer (m/f/x) at Visable Labs, you will be part of our User Engagement team to engage and inform different audiences across a wide variety of channels (web and mobile). You will also support the App development team who is working on a first mobile application

    We provide you with challenges

    • Continuous iteration on ideas, prototypes, and concepts to integrate user insights into your designs
    • Build a consistent UI and experience across the whole customer journey
    • Develop and maintain a detailed UI design style guide for use across the company
    • Deliver with autonomy, leading projects from conceptualization through to launch
    • Graphic Design for digital marketing creatives such as email campaigns, transactional emails, landing pages and more
    • In order to bring our initial App to market, you own the design cycle from the conceptual design, user research, and prototyping through detailed designs and usability testing to the final implementation

    We provide you with perspectives

    • The opportunity to shape the future of online B2B business and build a European champion
    • A multinational team with diverse backgrounds and languages
    • An experienced management team of serial entrepreneurs who know how to build a fun, fair and successful company
    • Regular team events, team breakfast, Mate, coffee & tea, snacks and much more
    • A spacious, contemporary and bright office in the heart of Kreuzberg
    • The ability to unplug from the office desk and work remotely from wherever you want once a month
    • A furry feel good manager (our Golden Retriever girl ‘Coco’)
    • And lastly, an ego-less, product-focused working environment

    And that’s what you should bring with you

    • 2+ years of experience working as User Experience interaction designer or similar role
    • A strong portfolio demonstrating a range of tools and techniques for designing clean through to content rich pages
    • Knowledge of UI design principles, grid systems, and responsive design
    • A combination of UX and Visual design skills
    • Experience in mobile app design is a great plus
    • Strong collaborative and articulation skills, communicating design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and teams
    • Working knowledge of Sketch, Zeplin and Adobe Creative Suites
    • Advanced English language skills. German is a plus

    If you would like to work with us, we would love to hear from you!

    Please send your application with a meaningful CV, portfolio, cover letter, and your starting date to Vera Unterberg: [email protected]

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Instructional Designer

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 20,000 businesses.


Our core values


  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar's remote-only team of 100+ people is growing quickly. We’re looking for an Instructional Designer who is ideas-driven, comes from a teaching or training background, and is passionate about making learning an invigorating and empowering experience. Candidates can expect to work with subject matter experts, a diverse range of formats and multimedia production platforms, as well as creating training for a wide range of audiences including customers, employees, and partners. Other responsibilities include developing objectives, rewriting and reshaping content, and developing and analyzing assessments.


Successful candidates should have a firm grasp of how people learn, and excellent design, writing, communication, and collaboration skills. Ideally, the perfect candidate should also have experience in managing projects and moving them forward.


*This is a full-time remote position available to folks located in the US.


  • Design and deliver training content for the customer services team and our customers that provides an engaging experience while growing both the breadth and depth of product knowledge and customer support processes.
  • Write learning objectives by working with subject matter experts to determine what is to be learned. Create the layout of the instructional material while determining the scope of educational projects and conducting research as needed.
  • Write and structure content and activities for optimized how people learn, ensuring the content matches established objectives as well as reshaping content for changing needs.
  • Provide creative and innovative treatments to exercises and activities that enhance the learning process.
  • Develop and test audio, visual, and interactive media aids as well as study guides and training manuals.
  • Analyze and apply trends and best practices in learning technologies and instructional design.
  • Devise modes of assessment, such as tests or quizzes, to measure the effectiveness of the course, analyze results and apply changes to content as needed to improve assessment scores.

REQUIREMENTS


  • Bachelor's degree in instructional design or educational design
  • 2-3 years of professional experience in a similar role
  • Experience working within a SaaS industry
  • Experience with a Learning Management System (LMS)
  • In-depth knowledge of learning theories and instructional design models
  • Lesson and curriculum planning skills
  • Basic design skills with associated technologies
  • Ability to write effective copy, instructional text, audio, and video scripts
  • Comfortable leading presentations and proven ability to coach others
  • High energy, enthusiastic, and growth-mindset communication style
  • Ability to function independently as well as part of a team
  • Ability to travel occasionally as required

BENEFITS


  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity / 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.



If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

items.title: UX/UI App Designer at Exciting Startup
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Take your experience and our app to the next level whilst experiencing all aspects of startup growth and entrepreneurship! Here at CLiKD We are currently recruiting for an intern with attitude. We are an early stage startup we are enjoying some great traction; you may have seen us featured on/in BBC News, Evening Standard, MTV, GQ, London Live, The Telegraph, Daily Mail plus many more, and we are looking for someone to join the team at this very exciting time. Our app is called CLiKD, you can find more info at www.clikdapp.com – we have been nominated for 4 awards and won best innovation in the dating industry 2017 as well as holding the number 4 spot for the UK’s best dating blog!


What we are looking for: People with a passion for business. Your number one aim will be able to help optimise our in app user experiece ! Working closely with our data insights team and developers you will be immersed in our user journey from app/play store presence through onboarding and the complete customer life cycle.


 


You will be part of fun and competitive team which is seeking innovative ways to stand out from the pack; organising events, collaborate with businesses and promotions etc. You will be managed by our CEO but also have scope to push your own ideas. If your looking to get experience, well we are a startup which believes in giving you the opportunity to try things. You will be a confident communicator, with strong communication skills and go-get attitude. You’ll need to be passionate about meeting new people and happy to muck in and get involved in a range of commercial initiatives as well as creative projects, content production aas well as having experience of using social media.


Whilst you’ll be working with our CEO, you’ll also have independence to work on many other small projects, hopefully allowing you to build your own portfolio of great work. This role is best aimed at those with some self taught knowledge looking to gain some further experience, or those wishing to put their academic studies to practical use or maybe you have an app idea yourself and would like to see how it’s done, as long as you are passionate about what ever you do then we want you!


You will be required to give us 2-3 days a week though we can be flexible to extent as to the time though this will generally be expected during 9-5:30. The company is growing quickly and we are keen to take people with us on our exciting journey and we are currently fundraising so we hope that post fundraising we will look to hire interns who prove themselves to be asset to the company. Unfortunatly though we can only offer renumeration in expenses (normally £15 a day) and company equity.


 


DUTIES: As well as your focus on app design you’ll be working in the heart of a startup with plenty of room to learn and try your hand in a variety of roles including, but not limited to: 
– Marketing; traditional, digital and guerrilla/growth hacking! 
– Press, PR and Media Relations 
– Fund raising and investor relations 
– Creative content; images, video and text 
– Technical; web and app development 
– Operations; project management, event organisation and logistics


SKILLS: This opportunity is for someone with the right attitude, but we do need some basics experience with social media promotion and candidates with these basics:


Technically proficient in terms of using office equipment
Excellent communicator 
An enthusiasm for creating business and talking to people. 
Confidence, enthusiasm and the ability to challenge conventional thinking 
-Anything else you can bring the table is a plus! HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, SEO, PPC, UAC, Web Design, Wordpress, Photoshop, Final Cut, etc. amazing, but by no means essential.


WHAT YOU’LL GET: The opportunity to work for an exciting new start up, learning about the fundamentals of marketing an app and growing a startup. 
The chance to work on some crazy projects: https://www.clikdapp.com/love-at-first-flight 
The chance to work on some great community projects: https://www.clikdapp.com/loveinlondon 
The chance to show off your creative side and work with other creatives: https://www.clikdapp.com/blog https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBE7SuipvhPp4snKJPhhOKQ 
A repository of portfolio work 
The opportunity to work with a wide range of interesting entrepreneurs and awesome brands. 
Weekly seminars from experienced professionals on a range of business topics.
A comprehensive exit interview including CV review and Letter of Recommendation.

items.content:
VoucherCart are looking to hire a Lead UI/UX Designer with skills in both user interface and user experience design.

The role requires a designer who can understand stakeholder requirements, the needs of the user and in turn translate them into highly usable and attractive customer-focused interfaces for web, mobile and desktop platforms.

A Powerful, Flexible & Viral Sales Engine: VoucherCart is a selling machine, and provides unrivalled growth and sales capacity to businesses of all types.

We are market leader in SaaS voucherisation technology globally, providing the world’s most robust and feature rich platform allowing businesses to create, promote, sell and redeem gift cards, vouchers and tickets.

VoucherCart offers a simple set of tools to sell flexibly with full automation and viral behaviours. Businesses can take payment in full and in advance across their full range of products and services as vouchers, gift cards, tickets, coupons, instant eVouchers, postal vouchers and reloadable NFC plastic cards.

Our existing clients are sector diverse and global: See client sample

===

You will work on UX/UI review and update of our existing client facing pages such as these:

https://hotel-cafe-royal.vouchercart.com/
https://p2r-murrieta.vouchercart.com/3888/kids-arrive-drive-race

As well as in APP development for the VoucherCart Apps.

Responsibilities:
You will be well versed in the principles of user interface design, user experience and interaction design, and will be as comfortable carrying out user research, as you are producing pixel perfect designs or constructing prototypes to illustrate how the products will work.

  • Designing variations and improvements to the VoucherCart Front-end sales pages, UX, e-commerce platform. Extending and improving our mobile apps to exceed the best-in-market standard.
  • Conducting research and mapping customer journeys
  • Ensuring the best user experience and high quality of every final product in regards to branding and business
  • Working closely with developers in the implementation of the created designs and graphics into final product
  • Working closely with the marketing and strategy team to ensure that the designed products exceed clients’ expectations
Person Specification:
To be successful in this role, you will need:
  • to Demonstrable UX, UI design skills with a strong portfolio for established (ideally global) web based businesses.
  • Experience of designing complex business-centric products across multiple platforms
  • UX and User Research skills (task analysis, story mapping, user journeys, personas, wireframing, testing etc.)
  • Proficiency in Adobe CC products, Moqups and collaborative products such as InVision and/or FIGMA.
  • To be able to work closely with BAs/Product Owners/Developers and Testing to ensure we deliver a product of the highest quality.
  • To be familiar with creating work at multiple points in the design cycle, from low fidelity wireframes to pixel-perfect moq-ups and work where necessary in the modification of HTML/CSS
  • To create and manage detailed design systems to ensure consistency in client experience across our products.
  • To identify and articulate design problems and solutions to stakeholders while pragmatically considering technical and business requirements
  • To be up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies
  • Ability to mentor junior designer and enhance their skill-set.
Benefits:
This post commands a competitive salary depending upon experience, along with an excellent benefits package.

  • Creation of UX culture in the company
  • Participation in interesting and challenging IT projects
  • Modern office with parking spaces in the heart of Katowice or Edinburgh
  • Improving qualifications at training courses, meet-ups, conferences
  • Flexible working hours and the possibility of partial remote working
  • Stable employment with high growth company
  • Informal atmosphere and integration trips
Job Type: : Full-time

Location: Edinburgh or Katowice (Full-Time), Occasional travel.

Salary: £25K-£40K (Depending on Location experience)

How to apply:
Applicants should submit a CV, and a short cover letter to jobs@vouchercart.com (maximum 500 words - including salary expectation, and current remuneration) explaining why you feel you would be suited to this role.

Please provide portfolio of your relevant UX/UI project works.

Privacy Notice:
As part of the recruitment process we will collect data about you in a variety of ways including the information you would normally include in a CV or a job application cover letter, or notes made by our recruiting officers during a recruitment interview.
Edinburgh EH8
£25,000 - £40,000 a year

items.content:
Front-End Designer

Full-time
Remote- US Based
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications

DESIGN YOUR NEW CAREER WITH US!

At Southleft, our specialty is front-end design & development. We have a track record of implementing large-scale front-end architecture and design updates for high profile websites with complex and heavy content needs. The quality of our code is exceptional, our sites are lightweight and fast, and we build our sites to be scalable so that our client’s investment will continue to pay off as technology changes over time.

WHO WE NEED

Southleft is seeking a creative problem solver who would love the challenge of building exclusive, fast, lightweight, and user-friendly websites for clients with novel and ambitious requests. Our ideal candidate for this role would have at least 4 years of experience in web development and a very sharp design sense. You should be able to manage your time well as a remote worker and be self-driven to provide excellent attention to clean coding detail, with the ability to accept feedback and implement positive changes.

 You may be ideal for this role if you:

  • Are highly knowledgeable and well-experienced with WordPress Development. 
  • Have a solid grasp of design principles and methods as it related to user experience and user interfaces.
  • Are familiar with HTML & CSS best practices and with CSS preprocessors such as Sass.
  • Have a working knowledge of Javascript.
  • Are familiar with Git.
  • Are able to:
    • Sharply design and develop creative, custom web solutions for our clients’ unique content needs. 
    • Engage in high-level communication with clients and coworkers via video, email, messaging, and in-person.
    • Manage time well as a remote worker and be responsible and self-driven. 
    • Provide excellent attention to clean coding detail.
    • Solve problems independently. 
    • Smoothly navigate among ongoing projects as timelines and resourcing needs ebb and flow. 
    • Express kindness and friendliness, listen attentively and respectfully, and provide excellent service to both clients and coworkers. 
    • Continuously learn, contribute ideas to the team, and accept feedback on work in order to develop and grow as a web designer.

WHAT WE OFFER

We believe employment is a two-way street where both you and the company should benefit from the relationship. For this reason, we offer:

  • the opportunity to work from home,
  • company-paid educational & training opportunities,
  • a flexible schedule,
  • new computer equipment,
  • a high-profile client base,
  • 15 days of paid time off per year,
  • 401(k) retirement plan,
  • room to grow & develop your job role and
  • performance bonuses based  on individual and company performance

Pay Range: $50,000-$74,000

items.content:
At WeGift, we’re on a mission to completely reinvent rewards by delivering open value, real time digital gift, on demand. So far, we have built a unique and trusted product and work with many of the world’s leading gift card brands (like Amazon, Nike and Uber) and corporate partners (like Perkbox, Vouchercodes.co.uk and Coinbase). 


We recognise that building a world class business requires a world class effort, so we make sure that each team member is appreciated for the unique value and skills they bring. We are driven by the knowledge that there are still millions of businesses and consumers (in a £600 billion industry!) that we can help. If you’re looking for an environment that will inspire you to dream bigger, work harder and make a difference every day, you’re in the right place.


The Role


We’re on a hunt for a Graphic Designer to support our commercial activities by communicating the benefits of our product through a beautiful, engaging and simple visual language and design . In this role you will utilise your skills to ensure that our designs help our commercial teams reach their commercial objectives and consistently deliver against tight deadlines.


On a day-to-day basis you will: 



  • Create innovative designs for our, decks, emails and all other promotional materials 

  • Explain complex technical ideas and systems through elegant, intuitive and beautiful visual designs.

  •  Highly motivated, organised and efficient – capable of working on multiple projects from the briefing stage through to completion within set time frames

  • Have the ability to work within brand guidelines, as well as the ability to interpret said guidelines.

  • Ability to produce a consistent high level of work to tight deadlines

  • Demonstrate a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.


 


What we are looking for: 



  •  Broad portfolio showing a range of design styles across print, digital and web

  •  Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign

  •  Fundamentals of MS Excel, UI/UX design, photography, and video editing/exporting

  •  An active interest in latest design and print trends

  • Experience in the SaaS tech sector 

  • Proficiency in MS Word and PowerPoint across PC and Mac platforms.

  • Digital experience - basic knowledge of wire framing and production of digital assets

  •  A desire to work in a small collaborative team

  • Great organisational and time-management skills


Compensation



  • £60k


Benefits



  • Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.

  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London or an uber cool Central Working space in Cambridge.

  • Catered team lunches every two weeks minimum.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
UX, UI Designer at ActiveState Software

Remote

Vancouver, BC – Remote OK

ActiveState Platform – made by developers for developers! We are reinventing build engineering with an on-demand SaaS Platform and CLI tool that lets developers automate the building of any runtime environment using any open source language ecosystem on any platform. In Beta right now, we support Python and Perl and we’re hiring to add more languages and packages! We’re building an ambitious language distribution platform so that no engineer ever has to suffer dependency hell again, and we need your help to do it!

This position is open to full-time telecommuters anywhere in North America. You can also choose to work from our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, BC.

What you’ll be doing

As a UI and UX designer you’ll be working with the Head of UX to design experiences and interfaces that help take the pain out of software development for teams. You’ll be working primarily on a web app but our customers interact with our product in many ways so you’ll also be involved in designing for a command line interface, email communication channels and even a code editor.

You’ll work with product managers to gather requirements for new features as well as feedback from the Customer Success team for improvements. Based on these, you’ll design detailed wireframes which you’ll use to first gather feedback, then refine, and subsequently convert into implementation-ready guides for our front-end developers. You’ll collaborate with our front-end developers to get features released by giving feedback and testing throughout the process.

It’s a complex project with lots of moving parts. If you enjoy making complicated topics easy to understand for a variety of audiences, you’re looking in the right place.

What Are We Building?

A set of tools that helps developers set up the coding environments so they can be more productive. They’ll be selecting from a variety of configurable components like programming languages and packages as well as specifying the operating systems that they need everything to run on. We take this “recipe” and build an installable runtime environment they deploy and modify as new requirements arise.

What’s In It for You?

  • Working for a stable and growing company that offers the environment and personal growth potential of a start-up.
  • The chance to work with a smart, passionate team of people.
  • The chance to work on a project that will change the work lives of developers around the world.
  • Competitive salary, bonus, and stock option plan.
  • Comprehensive benefits package and health/wellness credit program.

Duties

  • Work with a variety of stakeholders to gather feature requirements and produce detailed wireframes
  • Produce production ready assets and guidelines for front end development team and assist with implementation and testing
  • Implement and evolve a design language and style guide
  • Occasionally assist the marketing department with diagrams, images and feedback

Requirements

  • Strong knowledge of user interface design and user experience principles
  • Familiarity with an iterative design process that culminates in production-ready guidelines for implementation
  • Ability to work on a complex ecosystem of interrelated properties that work together to produce a unified experience
  • Good communication skills. You’ll be presenting work to a diverse audience as well as to gather & synthesize feedback
  • Ability to work within and evolve a consistent design language that spans across multiple properties and products.
  • Working knowledge of HTML & CSS to help guide your design process
  • Expert knowledge of design and wireframing tools of your choice

Assets

  • Previous experience working on developer-focused tools
  • Ability to create illustrations and diagrams
  • Ability to write HTML & CSS code
  • Previous experience with Github
Apply for job

We're also experts, thought leaders, strategic thinkers, problem solvers, creative, and tech savvy. mStoner is an equal opportunity employer. Job description

Radformation is seeking a self-motivated senior UI/UX designer with an eye for simple clean designs and layouts to join an innovative team.  This role is ideal for someone who is interested in impacting cancer patients throughout the country. The senior UI/UX designer is responsible for designing frontend UI features and creating a consistent design theme for the company across products and marketing.  This position will follow best practices to ensure consistency and high quality designs. Your design and leadership skills will play an integral role as we design new products for cancer centers.

Education and Experience

  • BS in related field and at least 5 years experience

Tech

  • HTML/CSS
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • UI/UX Prototyping Tools
  • Chrome Dev Tools

Preferred Experience

  • Strong eye for design
  • Ability to translate product requirements into a clean user experience
  • Javascript
  • React
  • Graphic design experience
Apply now

About Radformation

We create solutions that detect medical errors and save clinical time for clinicians with a focus in radiation therapy.  Using advanced algorithms and optimization techniques, our solutions bring automation to cancer treatments.   Currently, many safety checks and planning steps are manually completed.  Our goal is to help automate these processes for a more efficient and safer healthcare environment.

Our software focus on three key areas:

  1. Time savings through automation.
  2. Error reduction through automated systems monitoring patients for errors.
  3. Increased quality care through advanced algorithms creating patient treatment plans that are improved from current manual methods.

Benefits

  • Unlimited vacation
  • Health benefits
  • Dental benefits
  • Vision benefits
  • Stock options
  • Flexible work schedule

items.content:
Graphic Designer at Kinsta

Remote | Freelance | International

REMOTE · Budapest, Hungary · Design

DESCRIPTION

Kinsta is a modern cloud hosting company focused on WordPress hosting. We run our services on cutting edge technology and we are proud of the level of support we offer to our customers. Our talented and motivated team is scattered across the globe with team members hailing from every continent but Antartica! We’re constantly on the lookout for great talent to join our awesome team. If youd like to become part of the Kinsta family, hit apply or drop us a line, wed love to talk to you!

Kinsta is looking for a Graphic Designer to help our Marketing Team make beautiful website illustrations, printed materials (flyers, stickers, and even a book) and other graphic assets. This is a part-time opportunity for contractors and with the flexibility of working either remotely or from Kinstas Budapest office.

The key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Working with our design and marketing team
  • Ideate, sketch, and conceptualise illustrations
  • Ship assets for both Kinsta website and MyKinsta
  • Continuously improve and iterate the Kinsta graphic identity
  • Experience working with graphic design software (Adobe Creative Suite or Affinity)
  • Native level Hungarian and excellent English, both written and spoken
  • Great time management skills
  • The ability to manage multiple projects at once
  • The ability to come up with illustration concepts based on a headline or a short description

Bonus points:

  • Experience with making animations is a plus
  • Knowledge in sci-fi, gaming and pop culture references. We use these a lot.
  • This position offers a great deal of flexibility, you can work from the comfort of your home
  • If you are located in Hungary, you’ll have access to our calm and cozy office with a roof terrace in the heart of Budapest
  • You can shape the companys visual language, not just make pieces for your portfolio
  • Opportunity to work in a dynamically growing international company where what you do has a direct and immediate impact
  • Strong compensation package including frequent team-building and social events, as well as flexible working hours
  • We do not have any investors and we do not work directly with clients. This means we rarely have any deadlines and have the luxury of thinking illustrations through and drawing them nicely instead of quickly.

If you want to learn more about Kinsta and what it’s like to work for our team, head to our website, Kinsta.com, and look for the About Us link in the footer.

Apply for job

items.title: UX Designer
