items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Who are Tyk, and what do we do?



The Tyk API Management platform is helping to drive the connected world and power new products and services. We’re changing the way that organisations connect any number of their systems and services.


Whether internal, external, public or highly encrypted systems, Tyk helps businesses drive value across the retail, finance, telecoms, healthcare, or media industries (to name just a few!) If you’ve banked online, used an app to check the news, or perhaps even driven a connected car, API’s, and by extension, Tyk, make that possible.


Founded in 2015 with offices in London and Singapore, we have many thousands of users of our B2B platform across the globe. Brands using Tyk range from Singapore Post and Skills Future Singapore, to global organisations like Capital One, the Financial Times, and Starbucks. We have a varied user base hailing from every continent – even Antarctica.


Our Mission


The internet started by connecting mainframes, by the end of the 20th century 600m desktop and laptop computers exchanged email and web-traffic.


Today around 15 billion ‘things’ are connected to the internet, growing at a rate of a billion per year.


Tyk are committed to enabling interconnectivity between systems and between devices. We’ve started by building an API Management platform.



What can you do with us?We’re looking for a UX Designer to work on enterprise and developer experiences across a range of projects, you will work with an amazing collaborative team and have an opportunity to advocate what is best for our users throughout the organisation.


REQUIREMENTS


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Collaborating with other designers, developers and stakeholders to design enterprise and developer experiences for our core functionality and exciting new projects

  • Follow a user-centric, design thinking approach to solve real problems for users

  • Understand and organise the complex workflows of platform and API management into simple user journeys that inspire developers to keep building

  • Participate in user research for both concept and usability testing, and use the insights to define and maintain personas and user needs

  • Develop user journeys, workflows, storyboards, wireframes and interactive prototypes and anything else that helps you convey designs and concepts

  • Communicate designs with confidence internally and externally, and gather feedback to help take designs to the next level

  • Stay on top of what our users are doing, thinking and saying by collaborating with our customers and customer-facing teams, and be an advocate for them in all that you do

  • Be a key member of the UX team by contributing to the design system and participating in regular design reviews

  • Day to day, expect to attend project standups, plan and run ad-hoc UX workshops and collaborative sessions, create user journeys and flows of varying fidelity



  • Support the engineering teams throughout the planning and build phases of projects


 


Essential skills and experience:



  • Experience designing for technical developer and enterprise (B2B) tooling

  • Experience working with and driving a design thinking framework

  • Experience working with projects from conception through to delivery

  • Experience communicating and presenting designs internally and externally

  • Ability to use standard set of design software (Sketch, XD, Invision, Miro etc.)

  • Confidence in communicating designs to a wide range of stakeholders

  • Have a creative, innovative and problem-solving mindset

  • Ability to see things from both a macro and micro level (and know when to focus on each)

  • Broad knowledge of the end to end design capabilities (research, UX, visual)

  • Deep knowledge of interaction design, describing use cases, user flows and journeys

  • Inspiring others with evidence-based storytelling

  • Ability to work remotely with a distributed team

  • Willingness to learn about new concepts and adopt new tools




BENEFITS


Benefits


There is an attractive package based on experience and performance that includes equity. Everyone has unlimited paid holiday.


You will work with a talented, and passionate team of industry experts, who are developing a cutting-edge product that is driving change and innovation within startups and household names alike.


We’re a distributed team. Work from our London office during induction, once you are up to speed, you can work from home, a cafe, your mum's house, wherever you get your best work done, we’ll support you in making that happen.


We are growing rapidly and are looking for team members keen to grab hold, accelerate that further and shape our future.The Tyk API Management platform is helping to drive the connected world and power new products and services. We’re changing the way that organisations connect any number of their systems and services.


Whether internal, external, public or highly encrypted systems, Tyk helps businesses drive value across the retail, finance, telecoms, healthcare, or media industries (to name just a few!) If you’ve banked online, used an app to check the news, or perhaps even driven a connected car, API’s, and by extension, Tyk, make that possible.


Founded in 2015 with offices in London, Atlanta and Singapore, we have many thousands of users of our B2B platform across the globe. Brands using Tyk range from Singapore Post and Skills Future Singapore to global organisations like Capital One, the Financial Times, and Starbucks. We have a varied user base hailing from every continent – even Antarctica.

Senior Backend Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Corporate Training, eLearning
Company size: 501–1k people
Company type: Public
Company: gomo video | Sheffield, UK

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) Dublin
Office Location: Sheffield, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

java
postgresql
spring
amazon-web-services

Job description

We are looking for an experienced back-end or full-stack developer to join our remote UK team.

Tell me about Instilled!

Instilled is a new learning experience platform (LXP), meaning it is the very latest breed of learning delivery tools. Despite being new to the market, Instilled is built on a mature product with a solid client base and consolidates a wealth of experience and technology from our parent group. We are a small, agile team in a much larger learning technology business that is successful and passionate about creating outstanding learning tools.

What Instilled provides is a YouTube like experience for learners to discover content and progress at their own pace—it was originally a video platform, so included are a host of video features such as auto-captioning, auto-translation and commenting etc.

We are still in the early stages of this products transformation but we have huge aspirations and want developers that relish the opportunity to create industry-leading products.

How will I know this is for me?

First, this is a UK-specific role. Candidates must be eligible to work in the UK. Our team does have a US component, but we are not currently hiring for any US roles.

Our ideal candidate is friendly, enthusiastic and just as passionate about technology as we are. The team spans multiple offices and time-zones so a self-starter attitude and excellent communication skills are key. We know not everyone has experience of the learning industry but that’s fine, we want people that understand code. Our current tech stack is comprised of Java, Spring, PostgreSQL, AngularJS, and others. These things change though, so whilst prior experience is advantageous, the key is being able to adapt to whatever technology the task demands. We look for developers that have an opinion about how technology can be applied, but remain equally open minded about new or different approaches. Working well in a team is vital as this role will be fundamental in shaping our product architecture - clearly articulating a concept and nurturing other team members is hugely important.

Ok, sounds great! What do I do?

This is a unique opportunity to join a dynamic product team that is taking an impressive client list in to a whole new world of learning. If this sounds like a good fit then we would like to hear from you. Please send over a cover letter explaining why and attach your CV. Feel free to outline any achievements you are particularly proud of and include a link to code you can share. Extra points for your best joke!

Apply now

Benefits

  • Remote Team
  • Flexible Working
  • 401K Matching
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Annual Bonus Scheme
  • Health Insurance through Cigna
  • Workstation Equipment Provided if Needed
  • Respect for work-life balance and 40-hour/week norms

items.content:
Visual Designer at CareCentrix

Remote

Job Locations: Remote

Job ID: 2019-7831

Category: Marketing/Public Relations

Overview

CareCentrix is looking for a visual designer to develop a range of creative content for digital and print purposes including PowerPoint presentations, digital ads, product sell-sheets and website landing pages. This is a great opportunity for designers passionate about modern design and storytelling through graphics and visuals that will be used to build brand awareness, drives leads and support sales through clever digital ads, tradeshow displays, PowerPoint presentations, sell sheets, email campaigns and website landing pages, to name a few.

The visual designer will report to the marketing vice president and work closely with peers responsible for digital marketing, content marketing, sales support and conferences and events in work that will be highly visible across the organization. Candidates should submit a portfolio demonstrating design across a variety of content types that demonstrate design ethos and ability.

Responsibilities

  • Create high-level brand look-and-feel that will be applied to various assets and templates including presentations, letterhead, sell-sheets, case studies and white papers
  • Design and apply creative campaigns across a range of mediums including digital display ads, email, tradeshow events, print marketing/direct mail, landing pages, social posts, etc.
  • Collaborate with vice president of marketing and product and sales teams to create baseline presentations and support additional design requests
  • Create and curate a library of design assets including iconography and photography

Qualifications

Basic qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience developing PowerPoint presentations, templates and translating complex ideas into slides
  • 5+ years developing original graphics and layouts using suite of Adobe Creative Cloud products, or similar
  • Understand complex problems and provide clarity through beautiful, modern, simple design
  • Iterate on design concepts quickly from whiteboard to sketchbook to computer
  • Migrate design elements from one medium to another

Bonus qualifications

  • HTML, CSS, and/or WordPress a plus
  • Motion graphics or video experience a plus
  • Experience working in an agency environment a plus
  • Previous experience at a start-up or in-house creative team working on healthcare and/or healthcare technology, a plus

HOW TO GET NOTICED

The serious candidate will show off their work. Great branding work? Cool original design and illustrations? Nifty digital ads? Perfect presentations? Even your own projects. Let us see how you stand out from the crowd.

CareCentrix maintains a drug-free workplace.

We are an equal opportunity employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to age, race, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability, sexual orientation, gender identification, or being a qualified disabled veteran or qualified veteran of the Vietnam era or any other category protected by Federal or State law.

Apply for job

items.content:
We're looking for a talented Midweight Designer to join our in-house marketing team. 



Working alongside our Head of Marketing, this role will require you to deliver a range of designs across every brand touch point including print, digital, social, packaging, presentations and more. You’ll be the lead designer on our exciting new brand and so will have a great deal of autonomy with your creative executions.


Whilst the role is predominantly based in London, we offer great flexibility with working hours and where you work from. All we ask is that you maintain an open communication and ensure you deliver on the work set out for you.


The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years experience working across all areas of design (print and digital) and will feel confident figuring out how to work with new design formats as and when they arise. They will have a strong portfolio of work and feel comfortable, on occasion, taking the initiative if required.  


We’re currently in the early stages of our expansion, which means your role will expand as the company does. Above all, our team are a wonderful, friendly bunch who are all passionate about innovating in the ethical food space, so it would be a big bonus if you were passionate in that area too!


If you’re interested in applying, please send over your portfolio, CV, and a quick cover letter to tell us a bit more about yourself. We can’t wait to hear from you!


A bit more about us:

At Better Nature, our mission is to make our food system more people-, planet- and animal-friendly. And we think we’ve found the perfect way to do so - through the power of tempeh! Tempeh (pronounced tem-pay) fermentation takes any legume, nut, grain or seed (it’s typically made using soybeans) and transforms them into an even better food source. It binds them into a meaty block that’s high in protein and fibre and is great for the gut.


And it doesn’t stop there - our talented team is working with tempeh to make it even more nutritious, delicious, as well as turning it into lots of new and exciting high-protein products. To learn more about us, check out our website: betternaturefoods.co!

items.title: Design Director
items.content:
Design Director at Glitch

Remote | High-paying

NEW YORK CITY, NY OR U.S. REMOTE

DESIGN

FULL-TIME

Glitch is the friendly community where everyone can discover and create the best stuff on the web. We are a unique place for consumers, curators, and creators, and our design emphasizes people and what they’ve built over frameworks, features, or technologies.

We are growing every day, and we’re looking for a design director to build a team of talented designers. Our ideal candidate is a strong visual storyteller that can mold, refine, and evolve our current design operations, and help deliver a unified experience to our audience and work cross-functionally across teams to help make what we create feel like Glitch.

What You Will Do:

  • Oversee the creation and production of all design across Glitch and elevate the Glitch look with hands-on guidance
  • Work with team leads to prioritize, schedule, and streamline design projects
  • Develop and implement brand guidelines
  • Build processes to recruit exceptional designers and manage the design team

What We Are Looking For:

  • Multiple years of hands-on design experience and a track record of success across traditional, digital, and social platforms
  • Multiple years of experience creating and leading design teams, including a strong understanding of building consumer brands and experiences
  • Experience with UI, UX, user research, and visual design
  • Experience with branding, style guides, and pattern libraries
  • Experience with presenting and advocating for ideas and designs, and partnering across teams, including product, engineering, marketing, and media
  • Experience hiring designers, fostering career development, and scaling design teams

What to expect when you apply:

  • Your application will be reviewed by a real human. We do look at every application that we receive and sometimes this means it may take us a few weeks to get back to you.
  • You will hear from us in an email. After each phase of the interview process we contact each candidate to let you know whether or not you’ll be moving on to a next step.
  • Qualified candidates will be invited to an introductory video call with a member of the hiring team. The goal of this step is to get to know you and learn more about your professional and personal experience and ambitions.
  • If you are selected to move on, we invite you to a round of interviews with several of our team members. This interview stage typically lasts 3 hours.
  • Finally, we hold what we call our Operations Interview where you’ll have an additional video call with our head of HR and our COO. This conversation is intended to help us understand where you are at in your job search process and answer any questions you may still have about working at Glitch.
  • If you are selected for this role, you will receive a detailed offer letter that includes salary and compensation information and you will be given an opportunity to discuss this offer with our COO.

This position is based at our office in Lower Manhattan though we’ll happily consider US remote candidates as well. While our office is in New York City, about half of our employees are all over the US and the world. When you work at HQ, you’ll be in a brand new office, carefully and thoughtfully designed to give each person both private and collaborative work spaces. You’ll be part of a remote work culture where all of our meetings are online and apps and tools like Slack and Google Hangouts are the normal way to communicate.

We offer fair, competitive, and transparent pay. Compensation is $140,000 – $165,000 annually and we look at factors like your experience to make our offer, which comes with a comprehensive benefits package. We practice salary transparency and make our compensation clear and understandable. Glitch intends to set the standard for thoughtful and ethical technology, and you can learn about our values and how we run our company by reading our public employee handbook on our Careers Page.

Apply for job

items.content:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Plant Systems IT Scada Design Specialist-Remote in Phoenix, Arizona (AZ).

Essential Duties:
* Will have the ability to work remotely
* Participate in the implementation of technical solutions for Plant Operations
* Coordinate to identify, prioritize, and manage projects and technology tasks
* Contribute to project planning efforts including project definition, project justification/NPV, proposals, success criteria, risks/issues, requirements definition, technical design, testing procedures and documentation, system documentation, user training, and production delivery while coordinating and communicating with business resources
* Implement system enhancements and new systems through the project life cycle insuring appropriate documentation and processes to ensure compliance
* Manage projects for delivery of systems and applications to support Plant Operations and integration of Plant systems into Business Operations systems
* Install, implement, support and enhance systems and applications related to Solar and Wind farm SCADA systems and Integration of Plant systems into Renewables Operations Energy Management and Business Intelligence Systems and NERC-CIP compliance
* Install, implement, support and enhance systems and applications related to Solar and Wind farm IT/OT networks including routers, switches and firewalls, servers and desktops
* Consult with business and IT partners to strategize, plan and implement needed projects within designated time and budget constraints
* Proactively recognize and document business process gaps, propose and implement improvements
* Coordinate with vendors to ensure projects are implemented to standards for new implementations and for upgrading or enhancing existing projects
* Effectively communicate project and technology delivery expectations to cross-functional team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion

REQUIREMENTS:
* 4-year technical degree in information technology or equivalent experience (minimum 5 years)
* 5+ years of plant systems design, development, testing and deployment experience
* 5+ years of experience with installation, configuration and support of power generation plant substation relays, data concentrators, power plant controllers and OEM SCADA systems are required
* 3+ years of experience with array technologies such as operating systems, security, networking, programming, etc.
* 3+ years of experience with installing, configuring, troubleshooting and supporting Cisco network routers, switches and firewalls is required
* 3+ years of experience with configuration and troubleshooting of communication protocols like DNP3, MODBUS and OPC is required
* 2+ years of experience in developing and managing small to large projects through project life cycle working directly with cross-functional teams
* 2+ years of experience with installation, configuration, programming, troubleshooting and support of SEL 3555 RTAC, SEL 3355, Orion LX or other data concentrator and power plant controller equipment and software is required
* Experience with OSI Soft PI, Energy Management Systems and Meter Data Management System is preferred
* Experience with creating clear documentation and technical drawings is required
* Understanding of IT methodologies, processes, and project management
* Extensive knowledge of interfaces, integrations and process flows

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
This listing is for the London Office with occasional trips to Cambridge


Role


Delivering intuitive and beautiful designs and interactions that our users will love, and make the product a pleasure to use.


Responsibilities



  • Oversee the visual design and implementation process from concept to delivery, taking ownership and responsibility for all visual design aspects.

  • Work collaboratively with the UX Lead to turn complex requirements into delightful user journeys and interactions.

  • Deliver high-standard visual designs that surprise and delight customers.

  • Create high-fidelity prototypes in collaboration with the UX team.

  • Develop brand guidelines and UI Asset Library for use online and in print.

  • Foster critical and creative thinking.

  • Lead the way on the best-practice user interaction design and thought leadership.

  • Help users with their cognitive workload, so they can intuitively complete their goals.

  • Write your own briefs based on information provided by the product owner.

  • Work collaboratively with the development team to come to the best solution that mutually benefits the user and the business.

  • Follow a clear design process: Discover, define, design, develop.


Requirements



  • A strong track record of implementing a robust, consistent and intuitive user journeys and visual language.

  • A compelling portfolio of distinctive work that spans ecommerce, payments, product design and storytelling.

  • Confident and competent at managing your own workload

  • Expertise in cross-functional collaboration.

  • Demonstrable history of being fearless, boundlessly creative and relentlessly attentive to detail.

  • Good written English, ability to write product copy where appropriate.


What’s in for you?


We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us. We have taken the time to tailor a number of them to fit our culture and ethos.


Compensation



  • £60-90k


Benefits



  • Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.

  • Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.

  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new We Work office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


 


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


 


Successful candidates will be contacted within two weeks.

items.content:
UX Designer

Leadfeeder is a fast growing international SaaS startup, headquartered in Helsinki. We are on a mission to bring web intelligence into business. Simply put, Leadfeeder helps companies know more about their website visitors, which enables them to convert promising visitors into sales leads. 

Currently, Leadfeeder is a buzzing remote international team of 60+ people and more than ten nationalities, and we are hiring many key people around the world to strengthen our rapid growth. 
We are looking for a talented User Experience Designer to join our engineering team. Our 20+ strong in-house, all-remote engineering team is responsible for developing new features, and otherwise improving and maintaining the Leadfeeder product. We are organized in feature-oriented, cross-functional squads. Each squad is responsible for specific features of the product and works tightly together with high autonomy. Depending on the product area, squads are comprised of Backend and Frontend Engineers, Designers, and are always paired with a Product Manager. We believe in listening to everyone's ideas and feedback – no matter what your role is, you get to have a say in the direction of the product and your squad.

You will do
  • Work cross-functionally with Product Managers, software engineers and business stakeholders representing the design team, facilitating design discussions and providing feedback
  • Making use of existing research and analytics as well as suggesting new research initiatives
  • Sketch out interactions and interfaces to help define new features and ideas, from pen & paper to wireframes to high-fidelity mockups
  • Iterate on ideas and feedback and decide on the most appropriate artefact which can be used for internal reviews and usability tests to advance a project
  • Share work early and often and seek out constructive feedback from peers, product teams, and other stakeholders
  • Participate and conduct user research to get input on designs and concepts, communicate insights to the teams to help them understand user problems
  • Work together with other designers to build and establish a consistent user interface and experience across the whole customer journey
You are
  • Passionate about the entire product development process: from researching and problem-solving to detailed interaction and user interface design
  • Able to think how to strategically roll out your designs in small steps to validate your assumptions
  • Able to work within an existing design system and know when to break out and create new, extensible patterns
  • Able to break big problems into smaller experiments to validate assumptions faster
  • Comfortable working in a remote environment
You should have
  • Strong understanding of interaction design, user experience and visual design
  • Experience designing digital SaaS products that solve real problems
  • Great written and verbal communication skills in English to help people across the company understand the rationale behind your proposals
  • Proficient skills with the design software of your choice – we are not dogmatic about tools
  • Basic understanding of web technologies like HTML, CSS & JavaScript
  • An online portfolio, or PDF that you can share with us to showcase your previous work
What we offer you
  • Competitive base pay
  • Possibility to work flexible and remotely for everyone (we do require a 4-hour overlap with European timezones)
  • Chance to shape how design influences software product development
  • Company gatherings twice a year somewhere around the world
  • International and diverse work atmosphere
  • Considerate, open-minded and supportive working environment
  • Interesting and growing field of business

items.content:
Hands-On Web Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior
Role: Designer
Industry: Consumer Electronics, eCommerce, Marketplace
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: refurbed | Wien, Austria

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Vienna
Office Location: Wien, Austria. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

html5
css
sass
responsive-design
user-interface

Job description

Your tasks

  • Work on A/B tests together with our product department
  • Redesign UI components for A/B testing
  • Implement designs in HTML/SCSS (using Go quicktemplates)
  • Design and implement new landing pages together with our marketing department

Your profile

  • Experience with user interface design
  • Experience designing and implementing websites
  • Experience with SCSS
  • Desire to write efficient frontend code
  • Experience with Linux or Mac OS
  • You have a website portfolio you can show us

Additional factors we appreciate

  • You can speak German
Apply now

About refurbed

We are a marketplace for refurbished electronics. These are phones, laptops and tablets that are completely renewed, look like new and function like new. The products combine low price and sustainability. We want to contribute to a more sustainable future. 

Small, highly skilled and fun remote dev team

We are currently 4 engineers that all work together remotely. We have in person meetings in the headquarter in Vienna regularly to meet each other and the rest of the company. Balancing fun and efficiency is a high priority. 

There is also room in the office for the engineering team. So you can also work from the office in Vienna.

The main focus of the company is to build a fast marketplace platform that can support multiple countries and thousands of transactions. Hence, the engineering team is one of the most important ones in the company. 

Collaboration across teams works really well. Although we are working remotely, we are still a strong part of the whole company. 

Benefits

  • Remote work
  • Highly skilled team
  • Flexible working hours
  • Sustainability driven business
  • Startup atmosphere

items.content:
Senior Art Director / UX Direct Response and Brand Designer

Full-time
Remote, Virtual, U.S. based
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications

DESCRIPTION

We’re looking for a world-class Art Director who combines the best of direct response UX design with branded storytelling design to help us scale our new brand… all from the comfort of your own home.

This is your opportunity to join the high-performance creative team we’ve been building to lead our charge into the rapidly exploding $250+ billion health and wellness field. We’re building the first billion-dollar brand that’s 100% virtual… and need your help.

If you thrive in a performance-based, advertising-driven environment and…

  • You consider digital brand storytelling design to be your biggest strength…
  • You’re a jack-of-all trades in graphic design, photography, video, motion graphics, etc.
  • You’re addicted to the rush you get when you see the results your work generates…
  • You’re obsessed with user behavior and strategic UX design…
  • You can easily toggle between website, digital ads, print and video projects…
  • You know how to balance beautiful design with conversion rate optimize to drive results…
  • You can work with different departments and spin a lot of plates without losing focus…
  • You’re a hands-on grinder and love rolling up your sleeves to perfect your work…

Then please read on as you’re the needle in the haystack we’re looking for.

To summarize the key points:

  • Salary: $90,000 - $120,000
  • Location: 100% Remote (we have virtual team of 50+ with no corporate office)
  • Benefits: Full Insurance (health, dental & long-term disability) + Robust 401k
  • Hours: 8:30 a.m. – 5:00 (preferably Eastern time but flexible)
  • Culture: High-Performance but Humble (no jerks)

Why Are We Hiring this Position Now?

Because we’re growing so rapidly that outsourced agencies simply are not working for us anymore. We believe that our best path towards our billion-dollar goal is to build a world-class team of strategic creatives in-house who GET our mission and can execute at the pace and quality we need to hit our goal.

That will allow us to cycle ideas, designs and creatives faster, more efficiently and with better results. You’ll be right in the center of the action, working directly with the company co-founders and the Heads of our Content, e-Commerce and Funnel teams to knock out one exciting project after another.

You will hit the ground running without being slowed down due to lack of resources as we’ve carefully curated a passionate, problem-solving team that can help you sprint from day 1.

We deeply appreciate the talent needed to craft designs & ads that convert. We deeply appreciate the unique skillset needed to properly strategize and execute on world-class website, ad creative, funnel and print design. And we deeply appreciate the discipline needed to get it all done on time.

You’ll be constantly challenged with exciting opportunities that will make you stretch and grow.

Who is This Opportunity Perfect for?

Anybody who is ready for their next growth opportunity who might relate to any of these:

If you’re tired of the commute, sick of burning the midnight oil, stress is dominating your life, and the cost of real estate is eating up your retirement, this is your opportunity to take back control, live life under your own terms and design a lifestyle that brings you joy, happiness and satisfaction.

Or, if you’re drowning in agency work, frenetically jumping from one account to the next, putting out fires, and getting eaten up with too much on your plate, this is your opportunity to simplify, focus and go deep – to pour your heart and soul into ONE big opportunity… and scale it like never before.

Or, if you’ve always wanted to be a part of the thrill of a rapidly growing company, but didn’t want to move to an expensive big city with all the madness, stress and high cost that brings, this is your opportunity to stay where you are (or move to where you always wanted to go) to design your ideal life.

Or, if you’re buried in a big, slow-moving company that doesn’t appreciate the value that a true high-performing, creative art director can bring, that doesn’t understand why the artistic details can actually make a huge difference in campaign performance…. or that thinks “anybody can do this”, this is your opportunity to step into the spotlight, to completely own something that has the full support of the entire organization from top to bottom.

Regardless of your situation, whether you prefer to work in the quiet of your own home, sipping a delicious cup of coffee at your favorite coffee shop, or outside enjoying the sunshine on a bright, beautiful day… AND you are a humble, high-performing individual who would THRIVE in this type of environment, then please KEEP reading as we can’t wait to meet you.

Who Are We and What’s the Company’s Background?

Our mission is to spread our metabolism-first way of living we’ve been busy perfecting for 8 years to a worldwide audience. It’s a lifestyle that’s 100% focused on getting you the results that matter: looking your best, feeling your best and doing your best. In the shortest time possible. And in a way that sticks.

That’s why our tag line is “Life’s Short. Make it Count.” It puts you back in control. It empowers you to fix your own problems. And it makes you want to tell the world about it.

Our vision is to do this by becoming a billion-dollar multi-channel brand that’s distributed via online, mobile and physical retail. We’ve been painstakingly building the products, services, framework and high-performance culture to make this happen. And now we’re scaling into a much larger stage.

We’ve built a full ecosystem of products and services that allow someone to live a metabolism-first lifestyle. This includes exercise and nutrition programs, nutraceuticals, functional foods and membership programs. We’re launching a mobile app next year, then will push into offline retail, extend into home-delivered meals and more. But ONE thing at a time, just like we’ve done for 8 years.

Our next major step is rolling out our new Metabolic Living brand and centralized e-commerce website at www.metabolicliving.com, scheduled to be live by November. As part of this, we will consolidate our various product-driven microsites where we drive our media buys like at www.metabolicrenewal.com.

So why is a metabolism-first lifestyle needed? Because there are record amounts of sick, overweight, tired and depressed people piling up in virtually every country. Why is that? Because we’re over-worked, over-stressed, over-fed and toxic. And we’re deprived of the sleep, nutrition, exercise, movement and relaxation we need to thrive. That’s a recipe for disaster. And we’re seeing it.

Unfortunately, the typical solution of extreme dieting and exercise trap people into a 1-step-forward-2-steps back vicious cycle that actually makes them worse off. They bounce around from one latest flavor-of-the-month program to the next, never making any progress… staying trapped in a downward spiral.

Rigid philosophies like Paleo or Vegan, while extremely healthy for some, create an us-vs-them tribal mentality that’s self-limiting. Neither of those philosophies work for all people all the time… or even the same person all the time. People differ. People change. If that’s not respected, things will backfire.

We, on the other hand, present a framework that allows you to customize your life in a way that works best for you, so you can reach your fullest metabolic potential. Because we’ve found through working with millions of people that a fully optimized metabolism is what delivers the results you want.

Instead of fighting against your body or your life, we teach you to work with your body and life to create the perfect program for you. One that’s practical. One that’s sustainable. One that’s enjoyable. And, most importantly, one that delivers the results you want at any stage of life. And fast.

And we practice what we preach: our company is designed so everyone on our team both enjoys their work challenges while having plenty of time to do what they most in their life. We recruit only high-performing, humble people who produce in fast cycles, hold themselves accountable and have fun. And we invest a TON into our team, mentoring, coaching, teaching high performance habits and more.

What Will You Be Responsible for?

  • 100% owning our visual storytelling efforts whether in digital or in print
  • Drive all creative projects through all phases of production, edits and final execution
  • Create visual design standards for our new brand to ensure consistent visual messaging
  • Develop wireframes and designs to bring our new MetabolicLiving.com website to life
  • Craft key branding elements from concept to production for digital, print, social, product packaging (and eventually retail once we expand into that channel)
  • Design new e-commerce and direct response website funnels to support our $20MM+ annual advertising budget on Facebook, Google, YouTube, etc.
  • Collaborate with our Funnel team on conversion rate optimization for our website funnels with new designs, graphics, images, photos, videos, and other visual storytelling elements
  • Build out the visual elements for our ad creative, including image, video and email ads
  • Craft high-impact infographics with our Content team to drive social media engagement
  • Design key print collateral, including product catalogs, package inserts and direct mail
  • Develop high-impact cover art for our products that sells the big idea of each product
  • Lead the setup and direction of photo / video shoots and other key stages of creative production
  • Recruit and manage a team of specialized freelancers to fill any gaps in our internal design team including illustrators, animators, photographers, etc.

What Are the Requirements?

  • At least 5 years’ experience as a Senior Art Director
  • Expert-level proficiency in Adobe skills (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere, After Effects)
  • Robust integrated portfolio of work in digital design, video and print
  • Superior graphic design skills with an eye for pixel-perfect design that tells powerful stories
  • Combines a highly analytical and creative skill set with superior organizational skills to drive crisp, clean and effective execution on campaign ideas
  • Robust understanding of user behavior, UX design, print and digital page layout, wireframe and funnel design for direct response and brand design
  • Deep, intimate understanding of how to build direct response funnels that amplifies copy with high-impact art design driving consumer behavior toward a desired action
  • Excellent at articulating how high-level concepts will be transformed into finished creative
  • Strong project manager who simply has a knack for getting things done with an intense drive to optimize production workflows to deliver projects on-time, on-spec and smoothly
  • Excels at pattern recognition to identify key traits in successful competitor ad campaigns with the ability to synthesize those insights and produce new concepts to use internally
  • Enjoys the grind of relentless trial-and-error experimentation to achieve winning creative when working to “beat the control” on website funnel and advertising campaign design
  • You love to win, obsess over the details, plus you have an incredible drive towards excellence in everything you do and a sense of ownership to whatever it takes
  • Strong ability to collaborate with a cross-functional team to simply get things done – including leadership, strategy, creative, funnel, data, tech, etc.
  • Persistent desire for pouring through reams of ideas, B-roll, and stock images/video to spot the needle in the haystack and identify the perfect assets that tell the most powerful story
  • An unquenchable thirst for self-improvement, for constantly next-leveling yourself, optimizing your daily routine, optimizing your job and optimizing your team and working relationships
  • Extremely comfortable with Excel and other data visualization / analytics programs

5 Key Attributes We Look For:

  • Gets Results – Produces the most meaningful results the fastest by seeking clarity on company priorities, understanding the stakes while efficiently cycling through tasks.
  • Quickly Engages – Gets time working in our favor ASAP by immediately attacking projects with a sense of urgency, using just enough planning, while maintaining high intensity.
  • Takes Ownership – Delivers high-quality work by taking personal responsibility for projects with a deep sense of pride, anticipating issues, solving problems proactively.
  • Relentlessly Persists – Stays focused until the task is done by embracing a get-it-done attitude and relentlessly attacking problems at different angles until they’re solved.
  • Collaborates Smoothly – Gets things done faster and smoother by collaborating to trigger parallel work, listening intently and communicating quickly, accurately and transparently.

BENEFITS

What You’ll Enjoy from Us:

  • Competitive Compensation – This respects the fact that you are a needle in a haystack, a true high-performer who any company would die for to have on their team.
  • Flexible Benefits – We can customize your benefits to your specific situation, rather than forcing you to accept something that may not make sense for you.
  • Work-from-Home – A fantastic work-from-home lifestyle with flexible hours when needed with ability to carve out time to do what you love.
  • Curated Team – Peace of mind knowing we only recruit high-performing, humble people and that you’ll be surrounded by a supportive, high-energy team that respects you and your work.


If this sounds like a good fit, if you’re excited to do something challenging and meaningful that preserves your ability to enjoy life to the fullest, then please apply ASAP as we can’t wait to meet you!

items.content:
Paid Research Survey for Professionals with DataBricks Experience

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Data Scientist
Industry: AI Research, Market Research, Surveying
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: User Research International | No office location

Technologies

databricks
apache
data-analysis
data-science

Job description

User Research International is a research company based out of Redmond, Washington. Working with some of the biggest companies in the industry, we aim to improve your experience via paid research studies. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your feedback and experience.

We are conducting a research survey examining the experiences of DataBricks users and we are looking for currently employed Data Analysts, Engineers, or Scientists who are familiar with DataBricks.

This survey can be completed online and within 15 minutes. We’re offering $30 for participation in this study. We have included the survey link for the study below. Upon completion of the survey, gratuity will be paid via PayPal or Check, depending on your preference within 7 business days (you will be asked to provide your preferred method at the end of the survey).

--

Study: Experience using DataBricks Study

Gratuity: $30

Survey Length: 15 minutes 

Survey Link: DataBricks Experience Survey

Apply now

About User Research International

User Research International is a research company dedicated to creating useful, delightful experiences for both our clients and participants. We work with many companies’ products and technology to ensure usability for all consumers.

Benefits

  • Paid research studies
  • Improving tech
  • Getting your feedback and experience
  • Meeting researchers working directly on the products you use

items.title: Senior Graphic Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=1, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Senior Graphic Designer at Tinuiti

Remote
  • Location: Atlanta, GA

We’re looking for a seasoned Sr. Graphic Designer with specific experience crafting emails for e-commerce retail. This position will work closely with our client service teams to execute email design projects, and will have an opportunity to be a part of complex campaigns for some of the most innovative brands in the world. While it’d be great to have this role based out of one of our many offices, we are open for a telecommuting role (for the right candidate) within the continental United States.

We love the online space, and are marketing and technology nerds at heart. We bring on folks who have a sense of humor, want to learn and grow, and are excited to join a growing team.

Essential Functions:

  • Review creative briefs and client collateral to translate into breathtaking digital designs
  • Research agency clients and develop strong understanding of client style, overall brand, and marketing voice
  • Prioritize and execute on competing tasks via our project management platform to deliver results across multiple client teams
  • Partner with client teams on all revisions and alterations on digital design as requested by both internal and external stakeholders
  • Provide support for fellow designers as needed (vacation coverage, etc.)
  • Collaborate and partner with fellow internal designers for continued department growth and knowledge sharing

Competencies:

  • Creativity – Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
  • Planning – Accurately scopes out length and difficulty of tasks and projects; sets objectives and goals; breaks down work into the process steps; develops schedules and task/people assignments; anticipates and adjusts for problems and roadblocks; measures performance against goals; evaluates results.
  • Priority Setting – Spends his/her time and the time of others on what’s important; quickly zeros in on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks; creates focus.
  • Time Management – Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values time; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; gets more done in less time than others; can attend to a broader range of activities.
  • Dealing With Ambiguity – Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on; can comfortably handle
  • Self-Knowledge – Knows personal strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and limits; seeks feedback; gains insights from mistakes; is open to criticism; isn’t defensive; is receptive to talking about shortcomings; looks forward to balanced (+’s and -‘s) performance reviews and career decisions.

Requirements:

  • 4-6 years specific experience with eCommerce and/or consumer retail email design (a portfolio is required for consideration)
  • Knowledge of preferred mobile practices for email
  • The ability to study, learn and develop a thorough understanding of each client’s line of business and brand pallet
  • The discipline to work on projects that have specific direction, and minimal direction
  • Be comfortable juggling multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Experience in an agency setting preferred
  • Extremely detail oriented while balancing efficiency

About Tinuiti: Tinuiti is a performance and data-driven digital marketing leader, focused on every aspect of the customer journey across the quadropoly of Google, Facebook/Instagram, Amazon, Apple, and beyond. We believe success requires specialization across all channels, and our offerings cover the full spectrum from paid to earned to owned media. Our goal when we come to work every day is simple – to grow happiness. For our clients, their customers, our people and our partners. Growing happiness guides everything we do and our core values – Unleash Greatness, Never Stop Learning, Ignite Your Passion, Thankful Living, and Inspire Innovation & Change– inspire us to maintain a culture where our people take pride in their work and have fun doing it.

Disclaimer: This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. Tinuiti is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

FLSA Classification: Exempt

Working Conditions: Working indoors, sitting at a computer for extended periods of time, lifting no more than 10 pounds.

Apply for job

items.content:
UX designer

ProFinda
UK/Europe based remote position 
https://profinda.com

ProFinda is a remote-first software company based in London, UK. We help big enterprises discover the knowledge of their employees and match them to relevant projects, positions and other activities taking place within the organisation.

The role is an full-time, either London-based or remote,  with 25 days of holiday per year + UK bank holidays. If remote, you will be expected to travel to London periodically.

We expect at least 50% of your working day to overlap with the UK 9-5 hours  but we are respectful of possible time differences in case of remote work and lifestyle-related activities and offer flexible working hours outside the core time spent interacting with the rest of the team.

We are very proud of our team and our team culture. There’s no room for egos on our team, instead we try to provide everything that you need to excel at your role. We do our best to keep interruptions and meetings to a minimum. 

In this role, you will focus on UX/interaction design, creating prototypes, wireframes and high fidelity mockups for new and existing features and products spanning web and mobile apps to craft exceptional user experiences from start to finish.

Skills & Requirements

  • Strong and consistent user focus delivering creative and innovative user-centered UX solutions that will provide the backbone for an intuitive and compelling user experience
  • Conducting UX research, interviews and usability tests to inform design decisions and define user problems
  • Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and data-driven design strategies for mobile and web applications
  • Knowledge of best practices and platform specific design/UI patterns for mobile and web app platforms
  • Experience in an enterprise product and/or service development environment is a big bonus
  • Exploring several diverse approaches and validate the right solution with prototypes, validation testing and quantitative/qualitative customer research
  • Strong hand on design, wire-framing and prototyping skills 
  • Ability to document user experience guidelines, communicate guidelines to stakeholders in product, innovation, engineering and marketing
  • Ability to influence and lead thinking up to executive and senior management levels
  • Passion about new technology and latest trends in UX and UI.
  • Knowledge of frontend technologies and coding skills are a big bonus
  • Reliable high-speed internet
  • Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

We value intelligence, creativity and friendliness so you will be working with a friendly innovative bunch who are not afraid of trying new things and doing things differently.

items.title: Graphic Designer
items.content:
Graphic Designer at Eighty Sixed

Remote

Job Description

Eighty Sixed is hiring a talented graphic artist to work with our Art Department and Marketing Team to help us design graphical elements for our marketing campaigns and help us improve the design components of our website. Work with us remotely or on location in our Valencia, California office.

Responsibilities

  • Work with our Marketing Team to create graphical ads for our marketing campaigns
  • Work with our Art Department to create great new components for our website.
  • Provide rough sketches to demonstrate ideas and concepts.
  • Incorporate and execute design ideas from our marketing team.
  • Accurately set schedules and work well with deadlines.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in graphical design.
  • Knowledge of the graphic design process.
  • A firm understanding of design principles, typography and design theory.
  • Proficient in Photoshop and / or Illustrator. Knowledge of Adobe InDesign is a bonus.
  • A well rounded understanding of video games and love for geek culture.
Apply for job

items.title: UX / UI / Visual designer: exciting opportunity to join well-being start up
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About us


We’re building an innovative and ambitious audio platform in the well-being space. We think audio – podcasts, audiobooks and music - can positively contribute to people’s health, providing a much-needed balance to excessive screentime.


We’re assembling a small, core team to design, build and market the platform’s first version for mobile (iOS).


Who we’re looking for:


We’re looking for a great UX/UI designer to lead on the design of the app and all aspects of our visual communication.


What you’ll be doing


Working directly with the founder, you’ll be responsible for:



  • Leading the overall design vision for our mobile app, website and brand

  • Developing the brand identity by creating a consistent and distinctive brand language across all media, including website, socials, newsletters and the app

  • Refining the app’s UX (design principles, features, navigation, user experience and graphics)

  • Overseeing design sprints, iterating based on user feedback, analysing data on user behaviour, A/B testing

  • Designing wireframes, prototypes, complete hi-res designs and detailed specs pre-development

  • Creating reusable assets like UI kits, icons and illustrations

  • Developing creative ways to quickly validate new ideas

  • Working with developers to bring new product features to life

  • Support the marketing team in creating advertising graphics and other marketing assets


You’ll need



  • strong visual design skills

  • a track record of creating delightful user-centred experiences

  • excellent knowledge of current UX/UI trends and tools

  • hands on experience with identifying personas, creating user stories, wire-framing and prototyping

  • excellent knowledge of user psychology and user research techniques

  • Ability to design clickable prototypes in InVision/Marvel or similar design tools


We’re looking for a designer who



  • is thoughtful, curious and open-minded

  • likes to hear different points of view to get to the best solution

  • has a love of minimal, clean interfaces and the task of simplifying

  • has excellent communication skills

  • has a passion for technology, education, personal health and development


We can offer you:



  • Freelance/part-time role and/or equity

  • Track to full-time employment at seed raise

  • Remote working with willingness to move to Oxford area as we grow

  • The opportunity to gain experience in a fast-moving and ambitious start up

  • Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor visas so candidates must have the right to work in the UK.


To apply, drop us an email with a your CV and/or portfolio, linkedin/github/etc profile(s)

items.title: UI Design Mentors and Tutors
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
UI Design Mentors and Tutors

Anywhere

freelance

We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible, Mentor-driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education. Through our online programs, expert Mentors and Tutors bring students from complete beginners to junior UI designers in 8 months.

We are looking for experienced and passionate UI designers all over the world to join our pool of experts and help define the next generation of design talent by educating and empowering students across the globe.

Our global pool of over 200 Mentors and Tutors in the web development, UX design, and UI design fields has grown to include freelancers, entrepreneurs, consultants, and agency directors who passionately guide, motivate, and empower our students to create new careers in the tech industry. We are constantly searching for more teaching enthusiasts like you to join us.

We are specifically looking for EU and EU adjacent based candidates who can take on our students completing their course through the German Unemployment Agency (AfA).

Your Mission

Mentoring and Tutoring with CareerFoundry is more than teaching. It is inspiring newcomers to the field to build, to problem solve, to think like a UI designer, and to increase their value as professionals. With their expertise from the field, Mentors and Tutors provide guidance and encouragement to their students each step of the way, from sketching their first user flow, to producing working prototypes.

Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Tutor Role:

With their expertise from the field, Tutors work with Mentors to provide guidance and encouragement to their students each step of the way. To do this, Tutors provide feedback and constructive criticism on submissions, help students understand the lessons, and ask and answer questions about the materials to deepen their understanding of the core concepts. You’ll be:

  • Regularly reviewing student projects submitted through the CareerFoundry platform
  • Portfolio reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts
  • Working alongside a Mentor (who has 8+ years of experience)
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling
  • Responding to students within 12 -24 hours

Mentor Role:

Most students will be beginners, looking not only for help and experience to master the necessary skills, but also inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. You’re their link and point of entry into their new industry, so they want to hear that they’ll be able to make it (if they put in the work, of course).

Mentors review students work on a regular basis with a view to how it would fit into an industry-ready portfolio. Additionally, they book one-on-one video calls to help prepare students for their entry into this new industry. They’re going to want to know how you got your start, how you network, how you decide which companies and roles to go for, and much more! Your role will involve:

  • Reviewing student achievements via 15 minute video reviews.
  • Skype calls advising the student on career success (portfolio, CV preparation and interview skills)
  • Working alongside a Tutor
  • Responding to students within 48 hours
Requirements

To succeed as a Mentor or Tutor, you need to have a real drive to pass on your secrets for success to the next generation of design talent.

Tutor role:

  • 2+ years of professional UI Design experience
  • Assigned students depending on how many you can take on
  • In depth knowledge of industry best practices
  • Friendly personality and a strong desire to help other
  • Any previous teaching or mentoring experience is a definite plus

Mentor Role:

  • You have 8+ years’ experience in UI Design, with a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • A first class portfolio with rock solid, relevant references to back it up.
  • Ideally, you will already have gained experience in teaching or you have the right attitude and skills for it: you have time and patience for beginners and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field, with knowledge of the latest design tools, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.
What’s In It For You:
  • Flexible and mobile – work from anywhere with an internet connection
  • Educational – deepen your own knowledge of UX design by teaching it to others, plus work alongside a mentor who will also assist with your own professional development
  • Fulfilling – directly impact students’ personal growth, and help them succeed in their goals
  • Résumé gold – mentoring and teaching experience is highly sought after by employers everywhere

We’re looking forward to hearing from you.

Apply for this job ↬

items.title: Doist: Marketing Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Marketing Designer

At Doist, our mission is to inspire the workplace of the future by creating simple yet powerful productivity tools that promote a more fulfilling way to work and live.

We're a multidisciplinary, fully remote team that’s passionate about creating products, like Todoist and Twist, that improve people’s lives. We thrive on innovating new solutions to old productivity challenges and we seek to rethink how productivity tools are made.

When you become a Doister, you’re not only joining a global, remote-first company, but a team of 60+ people who value:
  • Feeling empowered to achieve their ambitions
  • Inclusivity, open-mindedness, and diversity
  • The wellbeing of their teammates and the people around them
  • Making long-term, high-impact decisions, even if they’re harder
We invite you to visit our blog to learn more about us, our values, and how we work.

Your role:
Doist’s Design team crafts engaging experiences that help make people’s lives more productive. Whether ideating marketing pages or functional interfaces, design is always a core priority for Doist. We are now looking for a talented designer to join our international team.
As a marketing Designer at Doist, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate not only with the other designers on the team but also with members of the development and marketing teams in order to ensure that our communication is effective, aesthetically pleasing and promotes balance. We're looking for someone who can join us to take Doist's design to the next level by creating solutions that perform beautifully on every platform, independent of the user's preference.

About you:
To thrive as a Marketing Designer at Doist, you: 
  • Have 2-5 years of experience in a similar role
  • Are skilled in user experience and digital marketing design (websites, emails, etc)
  • Have a thorough understanding of digital typesetting (typography)
  • Pay meticulous attention to the finer details
  • Have experience working in a variety of platforms and media, including web, print, interactive, email and social 
  • Are comfortable working with– and eventually evolving– pre-existing design libraries 
  • Have experience working on branding design
  • Are responsible, a team-player and happy to take the initiative
  • Have the ability to be able to form, prototype and confidently present ideas
  • Are fluent in written and spoken English
  • Are comfortable communicating with a multicultural team with diverse communication styles

Bonus:
  • Previous icon, illustration and animation work
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and GIT

Benefits:
We’re bootstrapped, profitable, and committed to building a sustainable company that will grow for decades to come. We’ve built a benefits package that invests in our employee’s long-term personal and professional growth and well-being. Here’s a sample of what that includes:
  • Work-Life balance. That means 8 hours of work, 5 days each week (for a total of 40 hours) because the time you spend outside of work is just as important as the time you spend working.
  • Flexible schedule and location. This is a fully remote position, so you can work from wherever you please and on a schedule that works best for you. All you need is a computer and access to a stable internet connection (which we sponsor!).
  • Generous paid vacation. 40 days of paid time off to use however you like (vacation, national holidays, etc.).
  • Paid parental leave. 18 weeks of paid maternity leave and 5 weeks of paid paternity/adoption leave.
  • Education stipend. You’ll have a monthly budget to buy books, courses, and other resources you need to continue learning and developing.
  • Competitive compensation.
  • And much more!

Designer at Jabil Circuit

Remote

Remote – USA

Full Time

At Jabil, we empower the brands who empower the world – it’s our reason for being and the guiding force that’s driving us to become the most technologically advanced manufacturing solutions provider on the planet. Whether we’re serving one of the world’s biggest and best known brands or the coolest tech startups, our resolve never wavers. We share common desires with these brands: to make the world a better, safer and cleaner place.

Requirements

  • Self-motivated; willingness to do what it takes, and at times taking on tasks outside of defined roles.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office Suite
  • Knowledge of HTML and CSS. PHP, JQuery, DHTML and other languages a plus.
  • Knowledge of current print, web/digital and video design trends
  • Positive and enthusiastic with a drive for continuous learning and skill development
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment and is adaptable to change.
  • Ability to be a positive contributor within dynamic team environments
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong conceptual and creative skills and commitment to customer satisfaction
Apply for job

Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Tutor Role:

With their expertise from the field, Tutors work with Mentors to provide guidance and encouragement to their students each step of the way. To do this, Tutors provide feedback and constructive criticism on submissions, help students understand the lessons, and ask and answer questions about the materials to deepen their understanding of the core concepts. You’ll be:

  • Regularly reviewing student projects submitted through the CareerFoundry platform
  • Portfolio reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts
  • Working alongside a Mentor (who has 8+ years of experience)
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling
  • Responding to students within 12 -24 hours

Mentor Role:

Most students will be beginners, looking not only for help and experience to master the necessary skills, but also inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. You’re their link and point of entry into their new industry, so they want to hear that they’ll be able to make it (if they put in the work, of course).

Mentors review students work on a regular basis with a view to how it would fit into an industry-ready portfolio. Additionally, they book one-on-one video calls to help prepare students for their entry into this new industry. They’re going to want to know how you got your start, how you network, how you decide which companies and roles to go for, and much more! Your role will involve:

  • Reviewing student achievements via 15 minute video reviews.
  • Skype calls advising the student on career success (portfolio, CV preparation and interview skills)
  • Working alongside a Tutor
  • Responding to students within 48 hours
Requirements

To succeed as a Mentor or Tutor, you need to have a real drive to pass on your secrets for success to the next generation of design talent.

Tutor role:

  • 2+ years of professional UI Design experience
  • Assigned students depending on how many you can take on
  • In depth knowledge of industry best practices
  • Friendly personality and a strong desire to help other
  • Any previous teaching or mentoring experience is a definite plus

Mentor Role:

  • You have 8+ years’ experience in UI Design, with a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • A first class portfolio with rock solid, relevant references to back it up.
  • Ideally, you will already have gained experience in teaching or you have the right attitude and skills for it: you have time and patience for beginners and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field, with knowledge of the latest design tools, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.
What’s In It For You:
  • Flexible and mobile – work from anywhere with an internet connection
  • Educational – deepen your own knowledge of UX design by teaching it to others, plus work alongside a mentor who will also assist with your own professional development
  • Fulfilling – directly impact students’ personal growth, and help them succeed in their goals
  • Résumé gold – mentoring and teaching experience is highly sought after by employers everywhere

We’re looking forward to hearing from you.

Apply for this job ↬

items.title: Uscreen: Video Marketing & Creator
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Video Marketing & Creator

Ready to create some video magic? Are you a smart, motivated individual seeking to jump into a company and learn a whole bunch and create some awesome videos for Youtube?

@ Uscreen, we help companies monetize & stream videos, we work with thousands of content creators looking to make money from their videos above just basic ad revenue from Youtube.  Uscreen allows you to sell your videos directly to your audience with no revenue share or commissions.

Our team is growing and we’re looking for amazing talent to join our pack. This position is best suited for a video creator to help create content for our Youtube channel.  The right person will help us with the full life cycle of creating videos.  This includes initial research and re-purposing and re-using of a lot of content we have already created on our blog, ebooks, etc, writing a script, executing the complete video capture & presentation, and helping post it on YT.  Don't worry our team is here to help and will get you on your feet quickly, but we want someone motivated and excited about creating videos.

You will be in charge of the complete Youtube lifecycle, from script > production > capture > posting.  Our team will be here to help you in every step of the way.

We will need someone who is very excited and motivated to work within the video industry and learn everything about our very exciting industry of video monetization & distribution.

Our team is incredibly passionate, smart, supportive, skilled, open to learning, happy to take constructive criticism and use it to level up. We’re looking for someone who can match that energy and help us scale.

About the role:

Our future Video Creator will work directly with our marketing team to re-purpose content and create beautifully engaging videos for our Youtube channel.

This role requires a solid presenter who also has the setup to capture the videos.  You will also write the script, setup the capture and present the content.  We are seeking someone who is looking to dive into Youtube and learn everything there is to know about Youtube.

This is a full-time remote position and is not suited for a digital nomad lifestyle. We require a steady internet connection and a mandatory overlap of working hours with the rest of the team.   Since this role requires video capture, you must have your own setup to capture video in high quality.

Must be:


  • Be able to present well on camera
  • Ability to write engaging scripts
  • Ability to learn Youtube well and its algorithm.
  • Handle the complete lifecycle of script > capture > posting of videos on Youtube.
  • Ability to work independently
  • Able to overlap at least 4 hours with our distributed team: from 6AM to noon ET
  • Quick to learn and able to understand audiences
  • Native or near-native English speaker
  • A confident researcher who loves facts, hard evidence and numbers, with source info to prove it (‘Trust me bro’ doesn’t count)
  • Overall a kind and fun person :) 

Our ideal candidate will also have:


  • Have an existing Youtube prescence and understands the video space on Youtube.

  • Loves creating videos and wants to increase their exposure with video.

  • Good sense of content trends 

Benefits:


  • Full-time (40 hours per week) remote job with a contract. We want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance / part-time position you can do in tandem with other professional endeavor.

  • Bonuses, Raises & rewards.

  • Join an amazing, creative and motivated team

  • Advance your career and progress within the team

  • Work from anywhere (OK, almost anywhere…), as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and reliable internet connectivity.

  • 20 paid days off per year (eligible after the first 6 months with the company)

  • Budget for personal development

How to apply:


Before applying, please note:

  • Apply using the link below

  • We review the applications and email candidates who qualify for the second round

  • The qualified candidates will be asked to do a test task: usually a video of yourself answering a few questions

  • After we review the submissions, we will organize a Skype interview with the successful candidates

Heads up! Due to the high volume of applications, we are thrilled to receive, at this time we are only able to respond to successful candidates.

APPLY HERE

https://forms.gle/6i4AhQfMH1HpdMGb6

items.title: Film Researcher/Essayist
items.content:
Film Researcher/Essayist

Company: New Rockstars
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Seeking an expert in film and literary analysis to bring that type of critique to the world of popular films. The ideal candidate has the knowledge to identify references to Kurosawa and Chaplin, identify Tarantino and Kubrick trademarks, and know the original Greek epic that influenced a modern story-- but, can apply it to properties like Marvel movies, Star Wars films, Game of Thrones, etc.

This expert would contribute research and analysis toward a scripted video going into any of these given topics. The submitted content would help develop a skeleton of points for the final script, but color may be added by other writers.

As long as there is a connection to popular film or TV shows, there is a chance a pitch may be accepted. Identifying motifs in Marvel films, script analysis of the latest Star Wars movie, or an observed trend in the latest Pixar films-- these are all the types of things that could work.

Examples of the style of analysis we are seeking:

The videos on these pages-

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuPgdqQKpq4T4zeqmTelnFg

https://www.youtube.com/user/everyframeapainting

If interested, please send writing samples, and at least 3 pitches to [email protected]om.

If this ad is still up, we are likely still taking submissions.
